text: All of the food I ordered here are good. I'm giving 4 stars for that and I would have given 5 if the customer service is better. Didn't give me water unless I asked for it, the first time I ate here.

This is the best place to get fresh fruit smoothies that are made with whole fruit.  The pho here is made with a delicious broth which is flavorful and delicious.  The restaurant is clean and the ladies here are friendly. This restaurant is highly recommended.

Let me start by saying that my boyfriend is an amazing cook, which makes us both extremely particular about where we go out to eat - why go out to a restaurant if we can eat waaaay better for less money at home?  The one type of food that he can't cook is Vietnamese food, which we LOVE.  So, we researched Vietnamese restaurants online for an hour and finally decided to try Pho Sing Sing.    We were pleased from the moment we walked in.  The ambiance is clean, bright, and modern.  The service was so friendly and prompt.  Best of all, of course, the food was delicious!  We ordered two entrees and a soup to share and with tip, we spent a total of $32.00, which for the portion size and quality of the food, we felt was a really good price!   We went back a week later and ordered spring rolls, a different soup and the same entrees, and everything was still really great! We will be going again!   Some things to note when you go:   - The menu is somewhat limited, which is fine - better to do a few things really well than a bunch of things not so great.  We talked with the owner to see if they are going to expand their menu and she said that they do have daily specials that they are trying out to see which ones are the most successful and then they might add those on to the menu as well.   - CASH ONLY - they only accept cash.    Overall, a really great place and as locals, we are really hopeful that Pho Sing Sing will stay in business!
This place was great..awesome food, awesome service, TO DIE FOR watermelon smoothie..Will DEFINITELY return
Canh chua ca and ca' kho to...so good. ..love this place...bun man is good too...bun cha ha noi....yummy. ..yummy
So good!!!! Great service. I asked for white meat pho and they made it for me even though it wasn't on the menu. Great food and great service.

I really like the food here, but unless the owner of the restaurant is here, you get really bad service. Once we get our food that's when the service ends... We even have to walk to get our check, not drink refills or anything....

The pho was amazing as well as the fried shrimp and pork egg rolls. They come with lettuce, cucumber, mint and basil to make a wrap. Yum! The brisket in the pho was very tender and the broth had great flavor. This is family owned/run and the service is good and friendly.

Our family came here for dinner. Food was good in comparison to other Vietnamese restaurants in Vegas. Not happy to see when the bills came out was not same price listed on the menu. Everything was like $1-2 different than what it said on menu. Hopefully next time it won't be happening again.

Surprisingly the flavor for the broth is great for a bowl of pho . Most places is pretty bland ... They have great customer service . Food came out fast . No complaints . Great place to enjoy a bowl of pho .

FOODIES, if you want the best Bun Curry, Pho, and Ca Canh Chua (VNese sour/sweet fish soup), and fresh vegetarian dish, you should check this place out.  I came to Vegas last week for a convention and came here for our team's dinner which was arranged by our team leader.   Needless to say, our leader is a VNese foodie who knows how to COOK very well, so I trust her taste and went along to have my dinner at this restaurant in this Asian Food strip.  Bottom line is the whole team (made up of multicultural group) loved the food.  My daughter was crazy for the Bun Curry (Fish Curry with rice noodle) while my hubby devoured the ca canh chua.   While I inhaled the egg rolls, I also vacuumed the vegetarian dish down my tummy.  Our friends (VNese and Indian) were equally enthusiastic about the food and cleaned their bowls if Fish Curry.    The fish curry was delicious with just the right touch of potato, fish, curry, and sweetness while you eat it with the noodle/bun.     The Ca Canh Chua was Sooooo YUMMMMY. It was light, sour, and had enough fish and freshly cooked tomatoes, tomatoes, and some other Vnese vegetables that I don't know how to pronounce or write :(  Hubby ate it with rice but I ate it with Bun/rice noodle and it was most delicious.  Oh how I love thee Ca Canh Chua.    As I write this, my daughter hovers over my description and reminds me to tell everyone to order the FIsh curry with Noodle :)  IT IS THE BEST THAT SHE HAS EVER EATEN!!  She is VERY PICKY when it comes to curry because we have the BEST in San Jose and Santa Clara.  Sorry Aunties, Pho Sing Sing won on the Fish Curry.  Too bad that I have to find it in LAS VEGAS!!!!!!!!!   :(  I have not visited the Asian trip at my last trip to Vegas (5 yrs ago) so I cannot say anything before.  I was SHOCKED to see SOOOO MANY Chinese, Thai, Korean, Vietnamese, ...ese restaurants.  Had my leader not found this restaurant, I would not able to discern which restaurants to try.      On a side note:  I always take time to talk to the owners or waitresses whenever I love their food.   IF you find that the food is da bomb, take the time and let them know how much you appreciate their craft.    I find that most often, they are harried or trying to multitask that made them ignore you.   When I go to Asian restaurants (unfortunately), I have low expectations of any eye contacts or service :) hehhehhe.    I am lucky, however, that most owners love to talk to me and hear my unsolicited opinions :)

Too bad I couldn't give this a zero star.  I ordered pho with rare beef, and the soup wasn't hot enough to cook the beef.  The flavor is off, way too much cinnamon.   Service was horrible,  we had to get up to get our own highchair and it was so dirty.  We came here due to high rating, but was so disappointed.

This place is pretty close to what you'd find in Orange County where there's a plethora of pho places.  The taste is very similar and they aren't stingy with their most whatsoever.  Definitely did not disappoint!
This is my favorite Vietnamese place to eat in Las Vegas, you must try it for yourself.

This is definitely good eats!!!  Best Bun Bo Hue I had compared to other bland one like Hue Thai & some other Vietnamese restaurant in Vegas.  I tried mocha with grass jelly per owner' s recommendation and I loved it!!!

Best pho in town! authentic Bac pho.  You can def. taste the spices that most pho should have but don't have.  Food portion is really large.  They don't carry diff. sizes.  Chicken wings are amazing as well.  Almond Coconut smoothie is good after a long night :)
If you like Vietnamese food, try this one. The banh canh  cua is so good, and the service is excellent! We definitely will come back again and again!

Best customer service here. She took the time to explain the menu to me and everything. Best part was that I wanted to take a drink to go and she asked if I had ice at home/when I planned on drinking it because she didn't want my drink to get diluted too much. She ended up giving me a separate container of shaved ice bc I just moved in with questionable ice supply. Food was delicious, I had pho. Soup had great flavor, will be back.

I had to stop at 168 market to get some things and decided to stop and try this place since its fairly new. Very small and family owned, clean, and everyone was friendly, and I'm sure the owners wife waited on everyone, very nice lady. My soup came out hot, and in a timely manner, I wasn't disappointed! I would definitely come back! They also sell boba drinks here as well, a plus in my book!!
Foods taste excellent especially the broth. I will definitely come back again next time when i come back to Vegas.

Came across this lovely restaurant using Yelp and I must say its one of thee best Vietnamese Pho place I've been to. Food was delicious, restaurant was clean, staff was super courteous and friendly. Oh by the way, their water tasted refreshing unlike many restaurant tap waters.
Over priced. Small portions. Mediocre taste. Subpar service. Wouldn't visit again. I don't understand what the rave is about this place. Don't be fooled by the high praise like I was.

Great spot. Pho Sing Sing's got it. If you have a car or want to pay for a cab, go for it.  We rolled in right at 10am, and it was empty.  Service was fantastic and they let us hang out for as long as we wanted.   The pho broth is solid, and so is the summer roll.  I'd come back again.

Decided to try this place since my last Vietnamese food was back in Hawaii. My #30 Com Tam Bi Thit Nuong Cha was really good but I got hooked with their mango smoothie. The server said it was natural product not any powdered mixed and so it was, kinda addicting. I will go back for more with their smoothies.

Decent pho to be found here. Not the best in town, but worth adding to the pho rotation. (Photation?)  They seem to be a little skimpier on the ingredients than other places, but maybe it's just me. Their beef tendons have never been undercooked, though, which is all too common. The pho broth is tasty.  The bun bo hue was tasty enough, but I was surprised to discover it contained neither pig's feet nor a blood cube. Stick to the pho.  They do boba tea and smoothies, too. The boba green tea is good, but I got a smoothie once and it was so sweet I couldn't even finish it. I swear I could feel all the sugar crunching between my teeth.

Fantastic!  The Pho and Bun ga is some of the best I have had.  The Thai tea is so-so, I use Archi's as the barometer for that.  Service was good and the place was super clean.  This is my new go-to place for Vietnamese.
The sweet and sour soup is on point.  The fish hot pot on point.  The fresh squeezed orange juice on point.  I felt like a home cooked meal.  I thoroughly enjoyed the meal.

This review is soley aimed at the pho they serve here. I am far from a pho expert of any kind, but the pho broth here is really solid. I come from So Cal and I am quite familiar with SGV's Pho Avenue (Garvey Ave.) and a number of spots down in the OC Bolsa area, and this place's soup pair up with some of the good spots out there. I use to frequent the more popular 24/7 Vietnamese restaurant, but over the years the quality of their pho (their other menu items are still good) has gone down.   The flavor of the soup is really nice and I think they use a bit more star anise, so the soup has a nice mild spiced flavor at the end. The herbs they serve are pretty fresh too. I can eat a bowl of pho here without dumping any plum or sriracha sauce (IMO, the excess use of those sauces in the soup masks the quality of the broth).  As for the service, I can see why some people may complain about the service because of the language barrier. However, I can only speak on my numerous experiences there, and the staff here have been delightful. The mom is super nice and very considerate. I remember one time I took my friends here after a summer pool party and my friend was barfing outside in the parking lot. She came up to me and asked me if my friend was alright and came out with extra water and tea before we even sat down. She even ask my friend if he wanted to have less noodles and more soup (obviously, he needed a lot of fluids than solids :'D). This may not seem like a big deal, but she was being extremely considerate.  The restaurant itself is kept pretty clean. I judge an establishment a lot on their maintenance of their bathroom. In my opinion, if a company cares how comfortable and clean their bathrooms are, they really care about their customer/client's as well.   All in all, this is my go-to spot when I need some pho in my life and would recommend it to anyone.

Good food!  Friendly, efficient service!  What more can you ask for!   We had the Hu Tieu Nam Vang, Bun Mam, and an appetizer sampler, which was just enough for 3 people.  Yummy, too!  I didn't try it, but they have oxtail pho, fish noodle and a large variety of Boba Tea's.    Next time!

Not great at all!! There were three of us and we each ordered a different dish. All of them did not taste like the minimal standard as they should. The poor waiter could not understand nor hear us correctly even we were very polite and nice about his slowness...I would not come back unless they change the cook!!!
My fav pho spot in vegas !!! friendly although im not asian lol.  The stock itself is very delicious. You get your bang for your buck.

Im actually pretty new to the whole Vietnamese food thing, but I have found that this place tastes different than your regular 24hour pho place, in an amazing way. Im honestly not sure what it is, but the broth is on a different level. The wings are spicy, but oh so worth it. Jelly drinks are yummy. I will be back to try more of their menu.

I never written a review before but I must for this particular pho restaurant. We went there for lunch and when we first walked in the entire place was smokey (my eyes were burning!)!! The pho was salty and the egg rolls weren't good at all...no flavor! I had the BBH (spicy beef noodle soup) and it was ok. I thought this place would be good but it was a big disappointment! Service was decent. I saw the table next to us was complaining bc they saw that we got our drinks before they did and they were seated and ordered ahead of us! My husband refuse to come back ever and he's a easy eater!

The food was delicious! The atmosphere is very comfortable and it's kid friendly. The staff/ owner is very friendly. i ordered their specialty pho and it was perfect. The broth was delicious. My kids had shrimp spring rolls and they were pleased. They also have some boba drinks!  We will be back for sure!

Favorite pho place in Vegas... hands down!!!! We have been eating their since they opened on spring mountain. Now that they moved to rainbow/Sahara we are still going there atleast once a week! The pho broth there is  my favorite by far! If you like spicy and I mean real spicy ... be sure to ask for the grounded Thai chilies!!! No one else serves it like that or even whole chilies sometimes in town.

We have eaten here 3 times after they moved the restaurant from jones and they still have Really good food. The  fried egg rolls look and tastes homemade and are really good. Also the spring rolls were fresh and delicious and so was the peanut sauce. The pho's I have ordered were delicious . And the Bún tht nng was very good. The pork was not fatty at all. The fish sauce is really good here also. The service is always good and they are really friendly here. We'll be back for sure.

Love this place! 2nd time here in one week and both times satisfied my cravings. First I tried the banh canh (#22), then I tried the bun bo hue (#28? I forget). Both of these soups were flavorful and delish! Haven't found a place better than Pho Sing Sing for these soups so I will def be back! Plus customer service is great (which is usually not apparent in most Asian restaurants).
The best Pho soup we have had!!! People are very nice and friendly. Delicious fresh fruit smoothies. Awesome chicken wings!!!!!! Everybody who reads this must go to this place. Very delicious!!!

My friends and I had never tried Pho before so we decided to look up a pho restaurant with high ratings. This establishment popped up so we decided to give it a try. When you walk in, it's more a seat yourself type of place and the owner brought us menus. Most of the menu options came with pictures but absolutely nothing sounded appetizing; we didn't want to be rude so we said we would order drinks (boba and smoothie style drinks) so at least we patronized instead of just coming in, not getting anything and leaving. My friends both ordered Bobas and I wanted to order a strawberry smoothie. Before ordering, I asked the owner if she uses real strawberries in the smoothie or if it's a purée. She condescendingly responded, "I only use real ingredients. Nothing artificial."Ok.. So I watch her make my smoothie with a strawberry purée that she pulled from the fridge and she throws in a couple ACTUAL strawberries. Lady, don't lie to my face and make me feel stupid for asking what's in your product.  The smoothie was sooo sweet from the artificial flavoring that it was unbearable to drink and after we paid I threw it out. If you're looking for a nice sugar rush, order any of their smoothies! Honesty is key and had I known there was going to be mashed up, sugary strawberries from a box put into my drink, I wouldn't have ordered it.

"My mom makes the best pho", my co-worker said. And he was not lying! This is their restaurant, and it is the best pho in Las Vegas right now. Try the seafood egg noodle soup or sing sing special pho. You won't be disappointed.
What a great new Pho restaurant!!  Try their Pho soup! It's amazing and not loaded with salt.  You can taste all the amazing flavors in it.  One of a kind.  I'll be coming back for more and more!

I came here after researching the yelp reviews. As I am on low carb diet, I asked for pho but without noodles, only meat and vegetables. This has never been a problem before, in California or in Vegas. The lady, who I assume was the owner, made a huge fuss about it, and wanted to charge me extra for it. Every other place, and I have been to a lot of Pho restaurants, has easily done pho without noodles, and given me extra veggies at no additional cost. After a lot of discussion, she agreed to get me the noodle-less soup. The broth was decent, a bit too much cinnamon for my taste. The meat was sparse, only veggies were onion and cilantro. Rest assured I shall not come back or recommend this place to anyone. And after years of reading Yelp reviews, I finally joined as a reviewer to debunk misleading glowing reviews and give props to places that actually deserve it!

Tried it for the first time when in Vegas. It was a bit far from the strip but it was in a large lot with plenty of parking. The staff is nice and attentive. Their quality of ingredients was better than others places and the serving size was pretty big. It was around $9 for pho and vermicelli, which was a bit more than I expected for far off the strip pho place. However, I felt the price was justified, as I got more brisket and meatballs in my pho than many other places I've been to. There were some egg rolls with pork vermicelli and those were wrapped in rice paper. I personally like the thinner wrappers myself but that's just a personal preference. Pho broth was flavorful. If the was closer to the strip, I'd probably go back but otherwise, didn't think it was worth the longer drive out there.
Pho Sing Sing is very good.  The Banh Canh is especially superb.  The owner / chef is so friendly and sweet.

Tried this phi restaurant for the 1st time yesterday & I sure will be back. We ordered the pho combination, the soup was so flavorful and the meat was cooked to perfection almost like butter melting in my mouth. My son also ordered their freshly squeezed orange juice and wow! Best orange juice I've ever tasted. My toddler enjoyed it very much. I am also a huge fun if their peanut sauce for the spring rolls. It was so good, didn't taste like any other bland peanut sauce from different pho restaurant. Great customer service too. Thanks, we will be back!!!

Today, I am really happy when find out an exactly Vietnamese cuisine restaurant. I see their food made by their love for cooking. Their food tastes so good, clean, and fresh. I love Vietnamese food more and more. Especially, they have so many special unique Vietnamese food I haven't known before. Thank you for your friendly service! For me, Pho Sing Sing is the best Vietnamese restaurant in Las Vegas.

Replaced an old pho restaurant that was a favorite for a lot of viet families..   Came here on X'mas day for lunch. Pretty busy. Lots of canto people, surprisingly.   Service was quick. Food came out fairly quick. Tea is given in a pot, like a normal chinese restaurant. A lot of viet places tend to give tea in a tall plastic cup.   I had ordered the combination pho. Broth was normal? Nothing too msg filled or flavorless. Fairly good amount of toppings and meat. Think more tendon is given here compared to other pho restaurants.   Not a bad place. Would like to try their other stuff one day.
Amazing little cafe. Very friendly staff. And my very favorite #20 on the menue. Loved it for years...

My first visit after their new location. Needless to say, food was still very good and service was still very friendly. The price is a bit steep, but the quality of food is excellent. Definitely must try their Spicy Satay Beef Noodle, so delicious! Their egg rolls are yummy as well.

Poor food, poor service. Waited a long time for a rice plate  to arrive and the Pho came without bean sprout/mint/lime side. To make the experience worst, this restaurant charged for hot tea. Dined at numerous Vietnamese restaurants in the past, never charged for a cup of hot tea. Ridiculous! Wouldn't come here again!

I've been to a few Pho places around town. This place didn't let me down. Great portion size. Very yummy and well priced. Lot of families come and eat here so you know it's homemade approved. Two thumbs up for this yelper

We came here after a festival for a recovery Pho. I'd been going to all the different spots in Vegas, but this one had nice reviews and was only 3 blocks away. We got the Pho Tai + the well done brisket.  It is an unassuming restaurant but the pho broth and service was wonderful. The definitely deserve a check in. The broth was full and dark, with only a slight hint of anise.  You can also tell they didn't cut the beef broth with chicken broth. Amazing and great price.
This place is great for anyone looking for canh chua, cm gia ?ình (family dinners to share). Wonderful family staff!
Excellent food. My boys and I loved it. Everything was delicious. The chicken fried rice was delicious and the fruit smoothies are divine. Recommend this place 100% Great service as well.

My wife and I wanted to try this new Viet restaurant in China Town.  We were extremely happy that we did!  The restaurant is located in the 168 Market complex.  It is kinda meshed into a sea of grocery stores and other businesses within this complex.  Think of being in a forest looking for that one tree.    Once you find it, inside, it is a bit small, quaint, and simple.  Just like I like it.  After speaking with the waitresses, we found out that it is a family restaurant that is run by several sisters.  Below are my ratings for service and food:  Service - I give it a 3.5 stars.  We came during the busy lunch time.  And, because they were still refining their service process and procedures, it was a bit slow.  Unlike many of the Viet restaurants that we have gone too, they were very friendly, polite, and apologize for the speed and wait time.  Food - definitely a 5 star here.  I ordered the wings as an appetizer and Banh Canh (Seafood noodle soup) as the main course.  The wings were excellent.  It looked like it was fried and dipped in some spicy, sweet, tangy sauce.  It was absolutely delicious.  The only critique that I have is that the wings need to be larger.  They were sort of "boney", but TASTY!  Now, for the entree, Banh Canh... Oh my!  Wow is all I have to say.  Outside of my mother's cooking, this was probably the most AUTHENTIC vietnamese Banh Canh that I have ever had.  They got it absolutely right.  I wish there was more.  Overall, our restaurant experience was very good.  It definitely made our list of top Viet restaurants in Las Vegas.  And, we will return!  Enjoy!

Pretty darn good Pho. Price is about $9.99 which we at first thought was a little much based off places we're used to in San Diego but turns out the portion is huge. Lots of broth, meat, & noodles. Flavor is good. Shrimp spring rolls with peanut sauce was super fresh. We'll probably be back to try their Oxtail dishes.

I tried Vietnamese food for the first time here with my Vietnamese friend. The place was clean, while the staff was very friendly and nice. I thought the food was very good, but I really can't comment on the prices because my friend ordered for me and paid, it was his treat. I hadn't eaten Vietnamese food before so I didn't know what to order. I trusted his judgment which turned out very well. I'll be coming back here again.

A bit expensive but well worth it. A couple bucks more but not a big deal.   I'm from Orange County and there are many pho restaurants to choose from. I'm pleased to say that this can definitely compete!   The pho here has the most incredible al dente rice noodles. I don't like it when the noodle is overcooked on the broth and becomes mushy. The texture is perfect. If the broth is all important, the noodle is next.  My only gripe is that the sexy female graphic on the logo doesn't manifest herself as a server. It's just done in true Las Vegas tradition.  Thank you and please open up shop in Orange County. We got over 40k hungry Vietnamese people.

This is the best Vietnamese restaurant i've ever tried in Las Vegas. I ordered "bun mam" & it was so good like in Vietnam, my husband ordered banh canh, he said it was as good as his mom cooked at home. This placed run by family so they treated customer as relatives, so I strongly recommend this place for people that's looking for an authentic vietnamese food.

I usually go here for their Bun Thi Nuong combination with meat,eggroll and shrimps and extra veggies. Today i got the same thing and the veggies was so dried and dark. The noodles dried, you can tell its old. After digging the veggies up i found a long piece of hair half black and half blonde. They need to wear hat or put hair nets while preparing foods. Im so disappointed with this place.

Being from LA, I try not to take my food snobbery to other cities outside of my hometown. With that said, this place was below my expectations. My parents and I came here for Pho on a Tuesday around 10am driving back to LA. There were about four other customers in the restaurant since it was still before lunch. All of us ordered Pho with rare beef and well done brisket. I would generally expect something like Pho to be out in front of me within five minutes, but Pho Sing Sing had other ideas. Twenty minutes later with the place still near empty, our Pho finally came out.  My bowl of Pho soup tasted a little strange almost gamey. My parents also noted the same strange flavor. Perhaps the beef was old? Regardless, I was hungry and ate everything. As for my Dad, he found something strange when he was chewing on the noodles. He picked out some plastic from his mouth about the size of a half-dollar coin. The plastic was dyed slightly yellow from the oil and soup base. I think the plastic could have come from the noodle or meat packaging.    For those of you brave enough to order a bowl of Pho here, tell the waiter that you'll have the plastic bits come on the side and that you'll put that particular condiment in the bowl yourself if you feel extra hungry.

Just a review for late-night boba. Visited the 168 Market nearby and popped in around 9PM for drinks. Heads up about the $15 card minimum, ouch!  The two of us ordered 3 drinks, taking the third to a homebound friend on our way home- we marveled at how different and great each drink was! Opted for a taste of the traditional with the milk tea boba, the healthy with the super creamy avocado smoothie boba, and the downright weird with a grape smoothie boba, which was really more like a slushy but with an actual grape taste instead of that fake-kids-medicine flavoring I was initially expecting.  Service was a bit on the slow side, but they are a full service restaurant and they did have a group dining in for dinner, so perhaps it was just a timing issue, but the lady who helped us was very polite.

A great bowl of Pho. Clean, friendly, and great food. Average prices. My regular spot. Haven't had a bad dish here yet. Service is always on point. I think it's starting to catch on, because it is getting busier. Still no trouble getting a table, though. Legit af.

One day, my boyfriend and I were really craving canh chua, which is Vietnamese sour soup. A quick yelp search led us to pho sing sing! Now, whenever he comes to visit me, we always make sure to get some canh chua. It is just the right amount of tartness that awakens your palate and makes you want to come back for more.  We've also had the ca kho (braised catfish) and house special wings. The ca kho was a little too salty but if you eat it with the soup like they traditionally do, it's all good. I actually really liked the wings and the sauce they had for it. But I did not feel like the price was right for the amount of wings you got.  I am taking a star off because every time we've gone now, things are a little different. It's never consistent. Sometimes rice comes with the soup on the house. Sometimes rice is an additional order. Sometimes they like giving you the nuoc mam (fish sauce) and garnishes on the side. And sometimes you don't get a side of garnishes. LOL but my boyfriend and I like this place so much that it doesn't matter, and we like to think that this restaurant is just keeping us on our toes.

Damn! This place is on fleek! Haha. I ordered the chicken wings and wow was it amazing. The spring rolls and the peanut sauce was to die for. The pho was good too. Helped cure my hangover. I highly recommend this place the service was good and it wasn't busy at all. 5 stars. Try this place put, you won't be let down.

I went in for a quick bite at around 4pm. Also checking it out before bringing my family here.  When you enter, what are prominently displayed high above the counter are smoothies, not pho, do they have identity crisis?  They don't take debit card or credit card. I think that all restaurants must take debit card and credit card for any amounts, it is a "must" service for customer, especially in going-cashless age of today. Any one that doesn't take them gets 2 stars for service, max.

The sister was missing Vietnamese food after her trip to Vietnam. After reading a positive review in a local paper, we decided to give it a try. We were blown away by how flavorful the broth was. We ordered fish noodle soup, bun Cha hainoi and rare steak pho. The food was prepared by two sisters. Will come back.
Best foods. Clean and nice restaurant. Come back for 2nd day for 3 days trip to Vegas.

Really good food and surprisingly warm customer service for a Viet place.   They had fresh coconut juice in the actual coconut! And a selection of other drinks like the avocado smoothie... If I didn't have a limit to my stomach, I woulda kept ordering.

The 5 stars speak for the quality of the PHO! Other details would receive a different score- but all I care about when judging Pho places are the Pho.  My husband and I were out and about and suddenly had the PHO urge. We decided to try a new place out so we checked the map on Yelp and fell upon the doorstep of Pho Sing Sing. It took a good while before we got served, but it didn't seem there were too many people staffed for service, so we were patient. We ordered Pho as soon as pop got to our table and were graced with one of the tastiest broths in Pho I have EVER had in Las Vegas. They also squeezed their own fresh orange juice- that was amazing as well.  So...Key points to remember when coming to Pho Sing Sing.   AMAZING BROTH- PHO'NTASTIC PHO!!!   FRESHLY SQUEEZED OJ  Be patient...it's a mom and pop shop that seems to require extra patience for service stuff.  If you like really sweet treats you will love their flavored beverages.

This place is awesome with great service. Everytime I go there the owners are very kind and greet you like you're at home. The pho is amazing and they have lots more options if pho isn't for you. I would recommend this place to anyone.

This place has incredible food at low prices. I've been there twice. The first time, had the sea food chow mein- blew my damn mind! Second time, had the sea food pho soup- again bomb. Granted the service is not especially great being that I think the ladies don't speak English too well but the restaurant itself is nice and clean with a border line up scale feel. But who cares when you're serving the hottest  most delicious dishes in town! Definitely recommend. Tell' Eddie sentcha

I went here based on the review of #vegan pho. There is no vegan pho. Staff did try to pass pho off as vegetarian, but it contains meat stock. Review is based on trying to sell me something I couldn't eat by passing it off as something I could.
I don't usually yelp but this place is fucken bomb. Best pho ox tail around

Wow, this place was really disappointing. The service was very pushy, the pho was in the bottom 5 of all Vietnamese restaurants I have ever been to. The bun Bo hue was terrible and the cha Gia was very skinny and stale. Truly a waste of $. I will stick with Pho So 1 when in Las Vegas.

Standard pho that was skimpy on the noodles (most inexpensive item in the bowl). Really? Anyhow the broth was pretty average. I always taste it before adding anything. One thing they have going for them is that it came out relatively hot but not piping hot. It cooled down quite a bit when adding the veggies.   I also tried the pork skin spring rolls. They were pretty good and nicely wrapped. I hate it when some places have inexperienced people making their rolls that litterally fall apart when eating it.  The price is on the high side for Vietnamese food that is just average given that I have only tried 2 items on the menu.  What really annoyed me was hearing the owners bitch in Vietnamese about a group of 14 that sat on 3 seperate tables to another group dining there that must be regulars and only tipped 7.50 for a $87 bill for one table. Each table paid seperately and were out of towners.  The other people said that maybe the other 2 tables though the table that tipped did it for all of them. The owner just snubbed and said they did not mix it up when they clearly paid seperately.  I never speak Vietnamese when I go to any Vietnamese place and can get away with it since I clearly look Chinese which I am. It's amazing how rude and how much shit talking Vietnamese do when they don't think people can understand them. The group of 14 were Vietnamese also. So why did they expect anything more? I was born in Vietnam and have been around the culture enough to know that Vietnamese generally are shitty tippers. They usually are frugal people and I am not sure why the owners would think any different being in the industry for as long as they have.

Coming from OC, there is A LOT of pho places so I wasn't able to come across any good ones in vegas until now. I really enjoyed the service & authentic vietnamese food this place provides. Everything is up to par :) Must try!

I go here all the time with my girlfriend and friends. The owner and workers are always so friendly and attentive. I order the #8 Pho Tai and occasionally the egg rolls. So far ive never been disappointed and neither has anyone i brought!
The older lady and man that own the shop makes wonderful soups. If you're nostalgic for home-made soups your elders used to make.... this is the place!

Decided to try out this place one night at work with my boss. Got 2 #7's & a side of egg rolls. Total was $28, not sure how that happened but whatever I paid and left. Got back to work & I didn't expect that I was gonna have to make my own soup. Everything was on the side so it took 10 minutes just to put it together. Taste isn't bad but ginger is extremely strong. Over priced & nothing special. Egg rolls were disgusting. Won't be back

This place is by far, the most UNDERRATED pho shop in Vegas! I love this place! I cannot fathom my admiration for their food. This place checks all the marks my list. Food. Price. Service   First of all, let's start by talking about their broth. It's amazing. It's not watered down and certainly does NOT lack flavor. I think this place has the best pho, Vegas has to offer! Their pho is unlike any other; with flavors so strong and adherent, it's perfect!  We ordered pho gá (chicken pho), bún (a vermicelli bowl w/various toppings), pork and shrimp spring roll, and a rice plate. We got a little order happy. But that gets me going to the next thing   Price!  This place is exceptionally priced. They should honestly be pricing higher by how good their pho is. I've been to places where pho is priced at $20 dollars or so and they do not come up to par with Pho Sing Sing's pho. Their pho is the epitome of pho, itself.   After we ate our meal, the owner walked around and talked to us. She asked our genuine opinion of the food she prepared for us. She not only makes it sound easy, but as she talks about her food, you certainly feel the home-y aspect pho should bring to you. It's the love and time it takes to prepare pho that makes it so special.   Overall, this place is a GO-TO for everyone. Unfortunately, I feel as if it is so underrated compared to pho shops in Chinatown. This pho is superb and hits all the right spots.

I ordered rare beef and tendon Pho. It was good, but my beef was in big pieces that made it difficult to eat. Same problem with the tendon. It took them awhile to take my order, but the food came out quickly. I never got my water refilled and had to go to the counter to request more limes and then go back for my check. Will not return.

Pho sing sing was such a waste of my time. I should have known from the time I stepped foot in the door.i asked the waitress if the chicken wings were spicy and she said she can make them without sauce for the kids since they can't handle spicy. Her suggestion..so I say yes. Plain wings no sauce. Awesome. Chicken wings come out full of sauce and she says don't worry. Sauce no spicy. I taste first.lady is a liar! Ok. I  say. Instead of taking it back and making her make fix her mistake. I tell her we will keep it and just make another order for the kids.next batch comes out decent. Next we order ca kho tho and canh chua. She asked if we wanted to add meat to our ca kho tho.ok sure. Why not. Another one of her suggestions... fish comes out and there's no meat. Not a single one. I ask her and she says. "Oh. Well just eat it like that. We can't put meat in it now."if you are suggesting all these things, why can't you get thw order right.? Ok. Time to pay and we ask for the check. The lady says ok be right there. She proceeds to the counter totals us up. Then yells across the room and says you come here pay.wtf? Food was just ok for all the bad service here. Never again.

This is our second time eating here and the food is amazing, taste like home cooked food. We live near by so this will be our go to place for fresh home cooked food. The chicken wings are so good and night we had the oxtail fried rice that was delicious.
Ordered #14 and spring rolls. Everything was delicious. It's very authentic, fresh, rich in flavor, and the full of meat and tendon. I'll definitely come back.

Love this family owned restaurant! The service was fantastic and personal. During our stay in Vegas, we went there 3 times and tried different plates and they all came out perfect! Better than what I expected to find in Vegas.   My favorite was Bo Nuong Xa (lemon grass grill beef), hu tieu My Tho (very authentic), Beef Pho - beef was tender and the broth was just right! Also had crab and shrimp Banh Canh (udon noodles)- cant complain! Everything was great and couldnt be happier to find such family owned restaurant.   We also order smoothie drinks and they were made with REAL fruits instead of powder.

We just love this little place. The pho may be the best I've ever tasted. As we were nearing the end of our massive bowls of incredibly delicious pho, the chef came to our table to ask how we enjoyed our meal. We were generous with well deserved praise, and I asked if she used a traditional recipe. She replied that it was her father's recipe, and one that had been in the family for generations. This little place, not fancy but very friendly, is well worth visiting over and over and over again.

Decent by far not the best. The vermicelli noodles were undercooked. If you order the brisket pho you will only get three thin slices  in your bowl. But it did hit the spot after all night of drinking.

Awesome! The hubby and I were in town from L.A. We were craving pho, so we found this place. Sooo glad we did! The pho tasted fresh and delicious...I would say much better than most Pho in L.A. We will make sure to go back to this place every time we're in town.

It's sad to see this place is always so quiet. It's actually a nice traditional Viet restaurant with good flavor broths for the Satay Noodle and Pho. The rice dishes are also flavorful. The place is clean and the owners are nice. This is my new go-to for Viet food. Best part is that it's away from Chinatown.

Delicious bowl of pho! Very tender beef in the Pho Tái - actually surprisingly tender. Perfect amount of fat in the beef cut I guess! Jalapeños were a little weak, maybe they should upgrade to serranos? Nice broth - not salty. Asked for extra vegetables, and it was worth the extra $1: broccoli, orange bell pepper, bok choy and carrots were all included.  A sign on their drink cooler says $15 credit card minimum, but when I tried using a card the hostess said they use Square and her "phone is completely cracked" - whatever *that* means. Cash it is then?  Enjoyed it a lot. Come here if all you want is a bowl of pho with not much atmosphere. The mirrors on the walls actually kind of freak me out. Keep your eyes on your food and you'll be OK.

Been searching for a good viet restaurant in Vegas since I move here and haven't found anything til I stumble upon pho sing sing . Pho is great , very flavorful. Broken  rice dishes is pretty awesome too But the banh canh is to die for .. Very authentic! Just like the way mama make it at home. Now when my friends ask me what's the best Vietnamese restaurant in Vegas I can  say pho sing sing!

Foods ok. But the women that work at this place are not very nice!! When someone has a business i expect good customer service. If your looking for good customer service don't waist your time coming here.
very good authentic vietnamese food, the service is great! Little slower when its very busy but they make it happen with what small staff they have
I'm Vietnamese and a vegetarian. This is the first authentic Vietnamese place I've found that has the best food! I will definitely be coming back for sure!

Pho Sing Sing is sooo good! Before leaving Las Vegas, we stopped by Pho Sing Sing because we wanted something soupy to cure our hangover :) I'm Vietnamese so I typically don't order pho when I go to Vietnamese restaurants because I prefer homemade pho. So I opted for their banh canh. Wow, it was sooo flavorful! I It was one of the best banh canhs I've ever had! It definitely hit the spot! My husband, who is Chinese, opted for the pho like usual. I tried the broth because I was curious. Surprisingly it was really good! It tasted really fresh, and I could tell there was definitely no MSG there! I normally don't care for pho, but this time I kept alternating between his bowl and mine. The best of both worlds :) I definitely recommend Pho Sing Sing. It tastes like fresh, flavorful, homemade cooking :) We definitely left Vegas extremely satisfied! We'll definitely be back!

wanted some Pho after a foot massage-- since we're from LA, we yelped and picked Sing Sing-- ordered Pho #11 #13 and fried egg rolls-- pretty good! friendly staff thus good service-- not a lot of customers eating in but lots of pick-up orders!

This place has the best summer rolls In town! I usually order shrimp summer rolls that come with a sweet chili sauce and the tofu summer rolls that come with a peanut sauce. Their sauces are sooooo good! On point flavor with the peanut and sweet chili. The rolls are big! If you are vegan or vegetarian you could come here as just get the tofu summer rolls as a meal! I love this place for their summer rolls! So if you're looking for some good Vietnamese summer rolls, this is the place!

I am a tourist coming to Vegas at least twice a year, and I always come to Pho So 1 for Vietnamese food but on fourth of July, Pho so 1 was so busy so I decided to try this place out based on reviews on Yelp. I can say this is my most favorite Vietnamese restaurant in Vegas so far. I had Hu Tieu Nam Vang (the Cambodian style of noodle soup) and it was so delicious. Very authentic and tasted just like ones I had in Vietnam. My picky eater 1 year old love the noodle too.   Hubby had Satay noodle and he liked it a lot. The beef was so tender and flavorful. We also tried fish cake which I love so much, so crunchy. If you are not a fan of fishy dish, this is not the dish for you. I had milk tea which is so good. The servers were so nice and funny.   Besides, they also have Special menu that has Bún Mm, h tiu cá, bánh tm, oxtail ph. I would definitely coming back for mo authentic food.

Food:  very authentic and flavorful Vietnamese cuisine.  The noodle soups are tasty and the egg rolls are made in a unique way to emphasize crispness.  They are also full of good ingredients.  Finally, the fruit smoothies are very nice, especially with the aloe boba.  Service:  is friendly, attentive, and courteous.  They are one-the-spot and pay attention to customer needs.  Ambiance:  is clean and organized with booths, as well as big and small tables.  It also has a family/relaxed atmosphere that is welcoming.  Value:  is average for a Vietnamese restaurant.
Good menu for a small pho place that include some items not offered at mamy other pho place like Beef sate noodles and a duck noodle. Great flavor without being overly salty.

The customer service is ridiculous because the server has no service skill at all. I ordered a Pho special TO-GO, the soup and the meats are cold. I called to the restaurant, the server said she though I will eat it at home, so I can microwave it. She also mentioned  most of customers would do it that way. WT Pho... "most of " is not equal "all of ", at least she needs to ask the customer first, before she put in the order.
Pleasant service. VERY clean.  Offered white and/or dark meat for grilled chicken entree which was juicy and fresh. I found this place by accident and have put this place on my list of favs.

Low on taste.  High on price.    I was craving pho & fried egg rolls with the rice paper wrap.  Couldn't find many places in Vegas that serve up those kinds of egg rolls.  So, I talked my husband into taking me here.    Before coming, we decided on what we wanted because we anticipated the usual Viet-style service  - which is to give you the menu & zero time to peruse it before demanding your order.  And sure enough, our waitress did exactly that.   I changed my mind about the pho because I could not smell any pho aromas at all.  Not a good sign :/  I ordered just the egg rolls.    Hubby ordered banh mi, but was told "don't have".  Ummm ok... So he settled on chicken wings & taro smoothie with boba.    The smoothie came out first.  Boba was over cooked & mushy.   Egg rolls came next.  They had either been refried too many times or had been left in the fryer too long because they were extremely oily.   Chicken wings came out last.  They were unseasoned except for a drizzle of the sweet chili sauce that you can buy at any Asian grocery store.  Very bland dish.   Our 3 items cost about $25 total.  That's steep for Viet food.  Were we overcharged?  Idk.  Doesn't matter though because we won't be back.

It is a short drive to get to, at Sahara and rainbow, but worth it. I got the egg rolls and a fresh Taro boba no pearls. Both were 5 stars. Customer service is so good. Super friendly, super clean, nice ambiance. I hear they have the best pho and oxtail rice, so I will try that on next visit. Thanks!

I visited this restaurant with my son yesterday (Sat) around 2pm.   When we went in, 2 people there (assumed they were owners?) were taking lunch, but was greeted and seated immediately.  I read some review here saying it's "authentic", and that's why I wanted to try. The thing is, I don't know how authentic pho supposed to taste like lol Never visited Vietnam or had a bowl of pho there. So if I was told this is authentic pho, all I can say is "okay" :D  Simply based on my preference, broth was tad a bit sugary. But besides that, there's no harsh saltiness, good depth in broth, fresh garnishes, plenty of meat; it was overall pretty good.  One thing I appreciated the most here is, when ordered, I only ordered one pho, and asked for extra bowl so I can share with my son. When the extra bowl came out, it was accompanied by a pair of food scissors  if you're a parent, you know how much this small consideration was appreciated.  Good customer service! Good food! I will stop by again :)

Lovely family owned restaurant took the time to make a delicious plate for me near closing time. The meat, the noodles, the herbs, the fish sauce, brought me back to Saigon. Will return with more stomach

Today my wife just got out of surgery. That's why  I wanted some good soup but I don't really know where to go. I've been to pretty much all of the Vietnamese places around. So I turned to Yelp like I normally do if I can't decide on a place especially a restaurant. So we checked this place out. And let me tell you guys, this place did not disappoint us. They have some unique flavors of boba drinks. Their broth for the Pho is the Bomb! One of the ladies looking like the owner explained to us the difference of her broth from the rest! We enjoyed our late lunch a lot! Service is excellent because they personalized it. They paid attention to all our needs. We will be back for some more Very Good food! Thank You! Pho Sing Sing!

Empty on a Sunday morning so we were able to sit anywhere. Prices are decent, a bit higher then what I'm used to... (I'm from OC) $10.99 for Banh canh, $8.99 for pho tai, $9.99 for bun bo hue.   Friendly service and no weird tasting water. We asked for small bowls to share the food because we wanted a little of everything, and they gave us 3 which is great because I find that a lot of places will always give you not enough bowls. The Banh canh came out first and the owner was super sweet and told me (in Vietnamese) to eat it before it gets cold and that the other dishes were coming out shortly. Everything came out really hot, fresh veggies, lots of meat and delicious broth for all 3 dishes.   My sister didn't like my Banh canh but I did. She enjoyed her bun bo hue and her bf said the pho was good.   Definitely come here if you don't want to deal with the wait (and tap water) at other pho places in Chinatown.

Excellent service great food. My girlfriend and I are not very experimental when it comes to pho so we stuck with the pho tai. The broth had an excellent taste and the soup was fresh and hot. Even my girlfriend liked it and she is super picky. The standout though was the smoothies they're really freakin good I ordered the taro which tastes like cookies and cream and my girl ordered the strawberry and banana which was really good to she swore it was the best smoothie she ever had which is funny to me cause I know she loves her smoothies and ice cream. Overall great place I will be back.

Very good place to eat, highly recommend! prices are very reasonable. I always take out, last time I was there they made a mistake on the order call them back and let them know about the mistake they  replaced the order l'm very satisfied

What a contrast to Pho 87! (please see my review and DON'T patronize such jerks!) Pho Sing Sing was very friendly--no trouble to put a few veggies in the large $9 bowl for no extra charge. Tasty broth, which I understand is MSG free, and tasty meatballs, brisket & veggies. Totally recommend this spot. I'm going to try their smoothies too, which look amazing!

If you are in Vegas you must stop by!! The owners are so friendly and everything is delicious!! I can never decide what to order because I want everything! You must try the banana with coconut if they have it!
This is the best Vietnamese restaurant in Las Vegas, I order coffee glass jelly, hu tieu nam Vang

All the employees here are always so nice. The pho broth is bomb here! The oxtail... Not so much. It wasn't tender enough. It's way overpriced too. The rare meat is also not that rare. It's kind of chewy. I still love this place though. I'll just get meat balls next time. Lol   I think you're supposed to pay at the "counter" but they don't make it that obvious. For starters, there's no real counter. I was looking around for the cash register after waiting wayyyy too long for the check, then waiting wayyy too long for someone to collect my method of payment. They should at least put up a sign. Sorry if I missed it.   I will continue to come back here though. I really enjoy the pho broth and how nice the employees are.

This restaurant is not well known by many tourists, hidden away from other well known Vietnamese restaurants on Spring Mountain road.  Serving very good authentic Vietnamese food, clean restaurant and very friendly service.   Highly recommend

A wonderful little pho spot! It's clean, the food's great and priced well, and the service is lovely. What more can you ask for? I'd recommend it to anyone in the area that's looking for some delicious pho!

Living in the heart of Little Saigon (Westminster, CA) I'm accustomed to very good Vietnamese food. I'm a Bun Bo Hue and Banh Canh addict. So on my first trip to this restaurant I ordered the Banh Canh... All I have to say is EXTRAORDINARY! I usually have to add fish sauce for flavor to every dish... First spoonful of this Banh Canh, I was surprised that it had more than enough flavor to please the pickiest taste buds! I definitely recommend this on a cold, gloomy day or any day in fact! By far THE BEST damn Banh Canh I've ever had!!!!  Okay, on to the Bun Bo Hue. Like I said previously, I love lots of flavor in my broth, this soup was everything beyond my expectations. I usually add extra chili paste to this to make it even more spicy! But without the extra chili paste it was perfection. Squeeze lime! And you're all set for a belly full of happiness! :D  THIS WILL BE THE ONLY VIETNAMESE RESTAURANT I WILL DINE AT FROM NOW ON! Go now or your stomach will be mad at you. ;)

I Will never eat here again, first off I like start by saying that when I came into the restaurant around 9pm all the employee were all eating (5ppl total) and as they ate they took my order and credit card (very unprofessional) nevertheless I order a bowl of veggie tofu Pho to go and as I got home and got comfy I noticed that half way threw my meal I found a small roach... I was so disgusted that threw up, Awful moment I will NEVER again will I eat here !!

My favorite pho restaurant! And I'm Vietnamese! Have to come here at least once a week for the Bun cha ca thi la (dry). Their egg rolls are the best I've had in Vegas, they use rice paper wrap instead of regular egg roll wrap so they have a little chewy texture which I loveeee! The pho broth is very tasty All the ladies there are nice and friendly! Highly recommended for anyone want to have good Vietnamese food!

As we walked in we saw the "cash only" sign and started to walk out since my wife and I only had about three bucks in cash combined. One of the employees said they could take credit cards after we told them why we were leaving. How convenient. Obviously, they just don't want to deal with credit card fees. I can't fault them for that, but it's not exactly a business practice I like.  Our lunch consisted of the goi cuon ($4.95) -- shrimp and pork spring rolls that were missing any sign of pork. The bun cha gio ga nuong ($7.95) was decent. egg rolls and charbroiled chicken with noodles. The portion size was plenty but the chicken lacked flavor. Adding plenty of fish sauce helped a little. The broth of the pho tai ($7.95) had plenty of flavor and was the highlight of the meal.  Service was excellent and friendly. They didn't have a problem with me sharing the bún with my son and even brought out a separate bowl with noodles for him. Located at Jones and Desert Inn, it's closer than other Vietnamese places so chances are I'll be back.

We've tried many Vietnamese restaurants in the Las Vegas area, but we have now found THE BEST !! Pho Sing Sing has it all !! The food and reasonable prices are only surpassed by the superior service.  Located in the Chinatown area of Vegas, plenty of parking, clean and comfortable.  We could not be more pleased ! The 5 star rating is WELL DESERVED !! P.S. Don't even consider leaving without trying the Taro Smoothie !!!!

My  husbands friend CC recommended us to try Pho Sing Sing. What an amazing experience since I am just now becoming familiar with this delicious cuisine. Pho Sing Sing is new to our neighborhood and what a joy to have them right around the corner. It was cold out and I was craving something warm and delicious. I stopped in and ordered the vegetable Pho! It was great! I can't wait to try more amazing dishes. The staff was really sweet too! I am going to tell all my friends about this lovely little Pho restaurant that is sure to impress!

We recently moved to Las Vegas and once again started our search for the best Pho.  I must say we have been very disappointed with the pho places we have tried. I have been selecting based on Yelp reviews and some have had decent pho such as Pho So 1 but fall short with the horrible service.   Pho Sing Sing hit on all cylinders. Nice clean place with a good atmosphere and very welcoming upon entry. The service was great and they didn't disappear to never be seen after delivering the food. But the most important thing is the Pho. It was easily the best I have had in a long time.   The broth really stood out as broth that was made with care. The meat in the broth was all so tender and of high quality.   I was surprised to find they were only open 7 months so if you haven't tried Pho Sing Sing you should

Loved this place, the waitress knew exactly what I would like. Will for sure return. My bf ordered the pho bc he as sick. It sure did the trick! I ordered the fried rice and orange chicken. It was amazing. Love it. It is a far drive but it is very worth it

Parking: large lot.  Ordered my food and the lady got it wrong. I ordered egg noodles rather than rice noodles, she argued with me for a bit, which is why I am giving them 3 stars. I found the food extremely delicious though, the hue satay was really good and then dry noodles was really flavorful.   Credit card only if you spend a minimum of $15.

My boyfriend and I come here regularly for their hu tieu sate and banh canh tom cua. Happy to find this place when I first moved here (helps with my Cali food cravings). I also love their egg rolls appetizer and durian avocado smoothie.   Good service and friendly staffs.
We love the new location. The pho here is the best I've ever have. My husband and I really enjoy the food and friendly service. I highly recommend Pho Sing Sing.

Bomb food. Slow service. It was busy when we came in around 2pm but it was great. The pho, the springrolls, eggrolls, fried rice and vermicelli were all so tasty. No more driving all the way to springmountain for pho loveee it!
Best smoothies ever!!  Vegetable soup is also delicious for those cold winter nights!
Good reasonable asian food, kinda pricy but this is vegas. My favorite was bot chien.

FOOD: 4 SERVICE: 5 AMBIANCE: 4 VALUE: 4  A surprising find in a non-descript strip mall. It's not very big, and from the outside, it appears to be just a run of the mill Vietnamese Pho restaurant. However, once inside, we were greeted by a Caucasian guy speaking perfect english, promptly seated and offered drinks. Turned out he was the husband of the owner. But, he didn't stop there, he came back and asked us what we wanted, explained the menu items and checked back on us often.  We ordered the following:  1. Egg rolls: these were wrapped in rice paper and deep fried. Served with plenty of lettuce, mint leaves, pickled carrots and cucumber slices. Very delicious, crispy and stuffed full of tasty meats.  2. Sing Sing Special Combination: this is their special Pho which means every kind of beef, raw/cooked/tripe/tendon/balls, served with thin rice noodles in a savory, flavorful beef broth. You can really taste that the broth was made the right way with beef bones and me at.   3. Spicy Beef Satay: served with either rice or noodle. We found that it was unusual to find satay in a Vietnamese restaurant, but the owner assured us that it was a traditional dish where his wife came from. As the name suggested, it was more than a little spicy, but the satay sauce and roasted peanuts really enhanced the flavor of the tender slices of beef.   Great food, great service and fairly inexpensive, what else can a couple of hungry tourists ask for?

Very good. Bright clean friendly place. Eclectic mix of tunes playing in the background.  I had the grilled chicken, pork, and egg roll bun. There was an awesome tangy chile sauce on the table and they make their own fresh.  Also they have a huge boba bar with all fresh fruits, veg, etc.  One of the owners checked on us twice and then came over and chatted with us when we were done.  Will def come back.

Very good service but the food quality could use improvement. I always order bum (vermicelli) with grilled pork and eggroll. The noodles were stiff a.d the eggrolls tasted old. On the upside, the boba was delicious.
Wow. I need to write more words but "wow" sums it up lol. Best pho I've had ever. And I've been everywhere. Right next to my work it's so convenient. I'll keep coming back. No doubt
My family was craving pho and came here for lunch.  Service was not the best and food was average.  We probably won't come back.

It's my fourth time coming to Pho Sing Sing. I'm partially biased to Vietnamese cuisine because I had the wonderful opportunity to live in Vietnam for a couple of years. I would like to tell you now, this is by far the most authentic Vietnamese restaurant I have ever had in the United States. The Cha Gio, Goi Cuon is made fresh, unlike the other restaurants I've eaten at. The Pho Sing Sing special broth is spectacular - not salty or too much anise, it's perfect. Their portions are generous even their noodles (Ask my husband how I can just inhale noodles). My husband had their pork chop with kimchi and picked vegetables on the side; note - their Vietnamese omelette is to die for!!! We also had their dessert, made from beans, sticky rice - FINALLY A VIETNAMESE RESTAURANT WITH DESSERT! So good. Besides that, I love the whole family atmosphere they have. Rose, one of the gracious owners of this restaurant is so friendly. She took care of us. I truly believe in making your meals extra special, Rose gave us the best customer service. :)

I really enjoyed the pho here. I found the broth to be extremely flavorful, the portions were decent and the prices right.   Service was standard for a Vietnamese restaurant, nothing great or bad.   Overall, I'd say this will be my go to pho place.

We ordered #22 and #24 which are Udon noodles w/crab, shrimp & pork and egg rolls & BBQ port vermicelli.  Excellent and tasty food.  Friendly staff but never got H2O refills.   Service was a bit slow and dishes were not served at the same time.  Regardless we would still return.
Every time I go here it hits the spot. The Chicken Pho is always my go to and I can't get enough! The service is outstanding. Definitely one of my favorites.

It is a small restaurant I ordered the special combo pho, and my friend ordered a vegetable pho. The broth on both pho were absolutely delicious. You can taste all the subtle flavors that were used in the broth. You don't even need to add anything to it.

Quite possibly the most deliciously authentic Vietnamese food in Vegas. Imagine if you were in the country in Vietnam and a family invited you over for some Sunday dinner comfort food. This place uses real broken rice to deliver the best Com Tam dish ever.   Com Tam is a famous comfort food dish in Vietnam and this dish is superb and beyond authentic on every level. It is number 29 on the menu "Com Tam Bi Soun Cha" which consist of the most delicious shredded pork, a perfectly seasoned pork chop, egg meatloaf over fluffy melt in your mouth broken rice.   There are so many places here in Vegas that do not know how to cook this dish and use regular steamed rice instead of broken rice. Here at Pho Sing Sing they nail it authentically. Order it, you will not regret it and be in total foodie nirvana.    My roommate ordered the number 25 which is the eggrolls and charbroiled chicken vermicelli. It was amazing and such a huge portion.  We also ordered the Pho Dac Biet and split it. OH MY GOD it was incredible. The broth sends you straight into flavor heaven without all that MSG ickyness. It is so good!!  So glad this restaurant exists. It is truly a gem and makes me really happy to have such incredible tasting Vietnamese Food by people who truly know how to cook it.

1) The food wasn't that good. Usually Vietnamese food is pretty reliable, but this just didn't taste right. The soup was too oily, and the meat was seriously lacking.   2) The menu options are very limited, and a little odd. I asked if the seafood noodle dish had an option to get chicken instead (very normal for most Vietnamese restaurants), and he said no. Then he said, "so you don't want the pork heart in it?" It didn't sound like a joke. He did end up putting two slices of chicken in as a favor, but that was just strange.   3) The owners were babysitting their kid or a family friend's child... they lifted up the child so the kid could stand on the counter and play with the stuff that was higher up. This is the counter for food and she was stepping all over it with her shoes after walking all around the filthy floor. Not okay.

If you want real authentic Vietnamese food this is the place to go to. We started with spring rolls and egg roll. They were  very yummy. Had the Ox tail Pho. It was very GOOD!!! A must have!!! The Best pho I had in Vegas. Hubby had the Spicy beef noodle soup ( Bun Bo hue). He said it was very tasty and good. My mom had the seafood noodle soup (Bun Mam). Just to let you know this soup have a very strong smell. It's supposed to smell like that. She said " It was very delicious. Made just right. Have to be a true Asian to enjoy this."  I would definitely come back again :) New Location on Rainbow and Sahara
Pho tasted blain, no flavor . Not good at all.  You can't split the bill, ok I can accept that but the service was horrible.

It's hard to find a Pho spot in North Las Vegas so we ventured down to Sing Sing and we are extremely impressed. The food is delicious, the portions are huge, service is fast and very nice.   We have found our new go to Pho spot!

Overall great food and nice service, it's pretty clean inside too. I usually order their combination pho soup and their egg rolls which are so good. And their variety of drinks are delicious, I really love their Vietnamese coffee. I did put 1 star off because you have to spend $15 to use a credit card while most places require only $10.

I met five friends from out of town here for lunch.  Pho Sing Sing was chosen based on the Yelp reviews.  I ordered the spicy beef satay with rice noodles.  The pho broth was good but it didn't live up to its spicy descriptor.  I added a fair amount of Sriracha but that only added some spiciness to the dish.  I enjoyed the peanuts and sesame in the pho.  One of the people in my group said she tasted MSG the rest of the day.  I couldn't discern that but she knows better than me.  With the number of pho places, this would not be my first choice in the future.
Pretty darn good Vietnamese food for being off the main stream of Asian restaurants on Spring Mountain.
Food was not that bad just lack of service and didn't seem like they cared for the business or wanted the business. I got a bad vibe from server and the place was empty with me and another table.

I just came off my patrol unit graveyard shift. I have been here before and felt I needed to share this location with yelp. I normally go to the spinal rehabilitation center around the corner for my neck and noticed they where  "out to lunch" so I thought I would come over here and grab a bite before the spinal Officer reopens.  When you first walk in it is very warm with a relaxing vibe. Settle on the eyes after a long  night/morning shift.  I was not sure where to sit but then a kind gentleman "employee" said I can sit any where with a welcoming smile. I loved how quite it was for the time I needed peace. When he served me the meal I was not quite sure what I wanted but knew I was going to get the shrimp spring rolls they are very delicious.   But if you do not like sticky foods I'd advise to stay away. Still!! I love them very much because it is a light dish with vegetables, sticky noodle, carrots, shrimp and a sticky roll. The sauce?   The sauce is to die for. Man let me tell you the taste is just perfect. Not bitter, hot or tangy more sweet and nutty. Loved it!  And then I got sautéed beef w/ Lemongrass & Onions.  Wow just wow! Not to much vinegar or lemon it was a beautiful blend.  If you like food that pops in your mouth you must come down here. The staff is very polite and helpful when you are indecisive with your order. Lol  This will forever be my place until they go out of business which I hope they NEVER do.  Thank you for your service Pho Sing Sing!

Wow !!  I didn't check the price when I 1st visited here but today I check the bill after I paid . For 2 people $31 !! Really !?  I got  a Beef pho , my husband got Cajun shrimp with steam rice . Really over priced...
This is by far the best Vietnamese restaurant in town! I highly recommend the oxtail pho and oxtail fried rice! It's amazing
Best Bun Mam , banh canh cua... chè dau trang in town... best service . We will go there again and again

This place makes a great pho! I really loved the broth! This is what makes a great bowl of pho, right?  Deep beef flavor and a pronounced hint of spices used in making the "liquid gold", ie. cinnamon, clove, star anise, and others. I thought this was not a salty bowl of pho, which is often the case at a lot of pho spots, so I was again, pleasantly surprised with this bowl.  I got the Pho Chin Nam Gan Gau: Which is Rare Steak, Flank, Brisket and Tendon.  Brought to you with the usual suspects of Thai basil, sprouts, sliced rounds of fresh jalapeños, and lime wedges. I like to add them all, but it is completely customizable, along with various homemade chili pepper sauces and hoisen.  My girlfriend got the meatball soup and gave me a couple of them!  I noticed that the special of the day was ox tail pho, but I had already ordered by then, which is a true shame because back home, I always get the ox tail in my pho .  No worries! I was completely satisfied with the bowl I had and am ready to hit this up again next trip down here!   This place is Jake Approved!!

No wait but not sure if it's a bad or good thing. Service was top notch.  Prior to coming here, we went to two different Vietnamese places and they were so packed that even those who were seated has been waiting at least 20 minutes for their food (was told by the female sitting with her bf waiting for food - total wait was an hour for them) once i heard that. no thank you and lets move on. We came across Pho sing sing and were seated immediately with the server giving us suggestions on what is popular. Ordered banh canh and it was a party in my mouth, flavorful and not salty at all. Some of my friends ordered rice plates and the portion was decent especially coming from guys who works out on a daily bases. They can eat and for them to say that was filling and good. Pho sing sing - mission accomplished!

In my ongoing quest to find good pho in Las Vegas, I've finally found a second success.  Pho Sing Sing is located in a pretty large plaza on Jones near Spring Mountain. It shouldn't be overlooked, although I managed to do so for a long time. Perhaps I was put off slightly by the association of the name with a certain correctional facility in New York, but my mom recently cleared up my misconception my informing me that it was also the name of an old restaurant in Vietnam. With other dinner plans in the neighborhood falling through, it was an easy plan B to come here instead.  I went straight for the pho dac biet ($8.95). My order came out within a few minutes, which is a good indicator that they have a huge pot of piping hot broth waiting in the back, like any good pho restaurant anywhere should. The bowl was plenty large, and the tray of Thai basil, bean sprouts, sliced jalapeño, and lime wedges was reasonably sized. First taste of the broth definitely made me happy, and a squeeze of lime didn't change my liking of it too much one way or the other. The varied selection of meats, including thinly sliced beef, fatty brisket, and beef meatballs, definitely hit the spot with tenderness and savory flavor, and the noodles weren't anything to complain about. Cilantro and onions, also standard, completed the experience.  I'm putting Pho Sing Sing up there with Kinh Do on my list of pho recommendations for Las Vegas, and I have to give it the same rating to indicate that it's also among the best in town. It's definitely worth a visit if you're a homesick California transplant or even if you're a casual eater who mistakenly thinks that Pho Kim Long is any good at the namesake beef noodle soup (hint: it's not). The only minor quibble for me is that it's a few minutes farther from the highway than Kinh Do is, but that probably isn't relevant to all my friends in Summerlin.
I'm so addicted to their seafood banh Chanh. Best in town especially with fresh ground red peppers.  I came here with my family weekly to order banh canh.

Was craving pho today.  My boyfriend n I came to eat here.  So I order him XL bowl cuz he's a big guy n mine regular.  When it came out, the bowl was the same size but different style of bowl.  Regular was $8.99 n XL was $12.99.  What a joke.  Last time eating here.  Service:  they just drop off your food n never heard of them again.  What a service.  Yup a typical Asian restaurant I guess.  Eat your food n beat it.

The food was ok, I got same soup bowl which I always like it, but it had less meat then pho so 1. I like pho so 1 better, grilled beef was sweet and tasty. My BF ordered rice, which was pretty good though.

We were driving around looking for Pho in Las Vegas. We went to Pho Sing Sing based on the recommendations on Yelp. I had vermicelli noodles with chicken and egg rolls and my wife has the seafood noodle soup. We also had Shrimp Summer Rolls and a Taro Boba Smoothie. The food was very good and the service was excellent. The owner told us that she's a former singer that's why it's called Pho Sing Sing. By the way their Boba drinks are excellent. For example, on the Taro Boba Smoothie which we really loved, they don't use Taro powder like most Pho shops. They said they actually cook the Taro themselves and blend it in the drink so the drink does not get too watery or too sweet. It was in a local crowd so Pho Sing Sing was a good find-we'll be back on future trips to Las Vegas. The restaurant is only a few minutes from the Down and the Strip/ I-15- lo at Spring Mountain Road. This is in an area with Asian Plazas with Chinese Hong Kong/Dim Sun, Korean BBQ restaurants and Asian grocery stores etc. Check it out.

My friends and I were looking to enjoy some pho and spring rolls this weekend while being in Vegas. After reading a couple reviews we finally decided to drive and head down to this place. Shortly, after we arrive we were seated and our waiter quickly left without giving us any menus to look at. So we sat down patiently waiting until he noticed. (This went unnoticed for a couple of minutes) Finally he came back and placed menus on or table and did NOT even try to offer us any kind of drinks or water!!  I ordered a chicken pho.. unfortunately the broth had absolutely no taste alone. The shrimp spring rolls on the other hand were delicious! After receiving our food, no one ever came to check if everything was ok or if we needed something.. All of us had already drank up our water, and no one came to offer a refill either. My group and I are not ones to yell for service or look around to find the waiter. The service was definitely lacking. It was time to go pay, and the lady had already calculated the amount on her register, without knowing that I told her it was going to be separate orders. She did not hesitate to roll her eyes directly at me and make it obvious she was annoyed. (Which made no sense because we had told our waiter they were going to be separate orders to begin with)  Anyways, I felt that I overpaid for what I received and will not be back.  I hope if you're from another state, you don't waste your time in this place.

If I could leave no stars I DEFINITELY would!! So, I thought I'd give this place a try after reading a few reviews... VERY STUPID IDEA!!! I walked in and was the only customer... Ordered the #7 Pho Dac Biet... As soon as it was placed on my table, I had to ask for limes, Beansprouts, Ice Water and even Napkins... I tried a spoon full of soup broth before I added anything, and it tasted fine... As I added my limes, beansprouts and sriracha I started to mix it all around... As I was mixing I noticed something floating around.... As it rose to the top of my soup I found a dead COCKROACH bathing in my food... F@#king GROSS!!! I Stood up furiously spitting out what broth I had in my mouth, and almost throwing up from being nauseated... Manager or owner comes by and asks what's wrong and I immediately took out my phone camera out and said LOOK there's a cockroach in my Pho... She immediately knocks my phone out of my hand and kicks me out... Wow!! No apologies, no explanation, no NOTHING!! As soon as I left, Nevada Health District Called... I HIGHLY SUGGEST NOT EATING AT THIS PLACE!!! Unless you like EXTRA Flavoring... LMAO
Delicious Bun Mam, Hu tieu Nam Vang, bot chien. I really like it, I will be back again.

Pho in vegas has been a hit and miss lately, ranging from places that were good, but has gone down in flavor, to just down right "what the pho is this" type of deal.  I thought I had tried most of the pho places in vegas, but with no way of going more downhill in my hopes than before, I thought, "you can only fail if you don't try."   The pho broth was actually good...but as someone else wrote, there may have been a lot of MSG since I was parched soon after, and downing 2 glasses of water during your meal is telling.  The egg rolls have that rice paper exterior, which makes for a unique but yummy egg roll. Pho So 1 is the only other place I can think of that uses the same type of paper.   More importantly, the interior of the egg roll was amazing. I've gotten quite tired of egg rolls that either aren't crispy enough, over-fried, or just bland. The sauce was a bit strange tasting than what I'm used to (more salty than sweet), but, it was a good run today, and I am gonna say that this place is ranking at the top in the pho broth department compared to a few other places.
