Is it as good as OC pho? HELL NAW.   I give a SOLID 4.5 stars for now.
yay, a vancouverite can relate to them, as they opened a new one in Vancouver, BC a few months ago.  Kudos for family restaurants that spread their wings internationally.

The restaurant is called Pho Sing Sing but you shouldn't come here for the Pho. You can order the Pho if you'd like, there is nothing wrong with it, but where Pho Sing Sing shines is with its other regional noodle dishes.   This is one of the few Vietnamese restaurants in town that serve Northern style Vietnamese noodle dishes. I unfortunately didn't take note of all the names of the regional dishes, especially since I went the extra step and googled a few things on the menu to figure out what they were before I ordered them.   Come here if you are looking for a greater depth of options in your Vietnamese cuisine. It's located in the same plaza as Wendy's noodle cafe next door to a Taiwan deli. So much good food in this little area of Vegas!
Came here cause I saw they had banh canh which what I was craving for. Food came out fast and the soup was delicious. The workers were friendly too. I will come back here for more Vietnamese food :-)

Horrible, we will not return.    Pho Dac Biet = nothing special about the special Pho Tai = where's the beef (tai) Jalapeño and sprouts was old  Com bi thit Noung cha gio= meat was cold had to ask for new plate.  Meat could have been from last night - Yuk!  One last note, cash only

I have a radical idea for this business. They should only sell egg rolls and that's it. They should have combinations of egg rolls order like a chicken strip joint. 3, 4, 5 combos. They should have egg roll sandwiches and dessert! Ok you get my idea. They make amazing egg rolls. And yes, all they other items are top notch!

We are from OC, California. And pho/ viet restaurant are everywhere in OC but this restaurant is as good as OC. We came here for Christmas and so tired of buffet.  Our friend recommended to us. Omg so good.  Best pho in town We ordered  pho  (best) so good Banh  canh ( so good) But thit nuong (good) Com tam bi cha thit nuong (good) Hu tieu satay (it was ok, unique) We liked 4 of 5 dishes. Will definitely come back next time we are in vegas.

You can find Pho Sing Sing in the 168 market plaza on Jones/Spring Mountain, but you have to go deeper in to the plaza. It's a small little restaurant located right next to a HK cuisine restaurant (I think called HK Star?)  I'm a fan of this pho place as it really has the mom & pop shop feel to it. Everything feels and tastes homemade and the pho broth is perfect and great. The prices are not to steep either and I really like their spring roll appetizer... it tastes freshly made (which in Vegas I have found that most places have it pre-made and out for a very long time).  This is definitely my go-to pho place and they are almost always never fully so there are always seats!  Do note that when you come you should plan to either pay in cash or use venmo if in a group because there's a $15 minimum charge on credit cards.
tasty authentic vietnamese food. I got cha ca and it's the best cha ca I ever have. The waitress is very friendly and informative.

We went here because we've been here before, I think.  This is in a typical Asian strip mall in Chinatown, Las Vegas.  The food was decent and caters towards Asians.  I ordered a Beef Tendon Pho dish (I think #13), my husband ordered a pork dish with rice (#30) and my daughter ordered a vermicelli noodles with pork and egg roll (#24, I think).    We also ordered a black jelly mocha drink, an order of egg rolls, and spring rolls to go.  The food was alright.  My beef tendon pho tasted a little different than I'm used to, like it has some lemongrass.  It wasn't too bad though.  The egg rolls looked different than what we're used to, like they had acne.  But we were told that is the authentic egg rolls and they were gluten free.  The food was attractive, colorful.  We didn't know they didn't know they only accepted cash, no debit or credit cards.  So we had got a $3 charge to go get some cash.    The service was good.  Blake was our server and he gave us better service than I would have expected from an Asian person.
Very good authentic food and nice lady owner! Must go to Vietnamese restaurant when you are in Vegas!
Oh boy! The food is bomb. First time here, their Bun lieu is very tasty, Bun mum is so good.  Highly recommended if you are in Vegas. The service is excellent.

Found this really good hole in the wall pho place when I was craving it for breakfast.  It's definitely a well maintained mom and pops managed restaurant located in the same center as 168 Market.  The owner was very kind and he took my order. I wanted to try that Nem Nuong Cuong (grilled prom sausage spring roll) but they didn't have it here. However he suggested I tried another grilled pork spring roll and it was SO good! Perfect flavor of marinated, thinly sliced meat wrapped with a nice charcoal grill taste. Highly recommend it. I also got my usual pho tai with bo vien.  Noodles came out al dente, but perfect once it sat in the soup and cooked itself to the perfect consistency.  Good big portion. Soup was tasty. The rate steak and meatball was a great texture-- not too dry. Definitely will be back! Great service!

I really enjoyed the flavorful pho broth here, no condiments needed to be added.  Just a little squeeze of lime and it was perfect!    The Banh Canh is also very good.  It tastes homemade and they are generous with the portions.    For appetizers, the chicken wings were extremely flavorful!  I like how crispy they were.  I definitely recommend the drinks here also.  They have a selection of different types of dessert drinks.  I had the Honeydew shake and it was delicious!  Creamy and flavorful.    Overall, I was very happy with my experience here.  I can't wait to go back!

I've been to many Vietnamese Restaurants looking for real authentic Vietnamese Cuisine. Me myself being Vietnamese it was hard finding a spot that's close to home cooking. The way Moms already cooked it.   After coming inside with family, we were greeted and seated with care. Felt like I was going to an Aunts house for dinner lol. Place is clean & the many options of smoothies caught my attention. I ordered the Rice Plate since it's my most favorite meal. & wow...it came out fresh off the grill and prepared to perfection. I didn't get a chance to take a pic since I choked down right away. That's when you know the food was good.  I'm glad to find a place close to home in terms of meals. Will be coming down. Anything on Spring Mountain Rd are all "Fast Food" versions of Vietnamese Cuisine. If you want real authentic food. Come here! Underrated and the definition of a hole of the wall. But those spots are always the most unique and best places to dine!

This place is amazing! My wife and I were visiting family in Summerlin and we wanted to try a new place! It was very very very cold outside and it happened to be January 1, 2015! So we were in the mood for some hot soup!  Pho Sing Sing did not disappoint! From the warm welcome by the owner himself to the amazing Pho and specialized chicken spring rolls they made fresh just for our special request, I can't recommend this place enough! You must definitely try it when you're in town!

I don't eat Pho a lot but, when I do, I'm very picky. I don't like eat the noodles a lot. I eat a little. My main thing about Pho is the broth and Pho Sing Sing's broth was AMAZING I went to Pho Kim Long and it was my biggest regret of Las Vegas. Pho Sing Sing gave me better service and was more friendlier then Pho Kim Long. I wasn't rushed to order or given a bad attitude when I got there. Pho Sing Sing, you guys are the best!

I've been here a few times and every time the food was amazing and staff is very friendly. My favorite is the egg rolls (ch giò) and bánh canh tôm cua.  My bf loves his bún ch giò tht nng too. It's small and hidden but food is on point !

Lousy attitudes, not really care about what we order. I heard more cup, spoon, and chop sticks dropping. Kind of like accident happening.   We order fresh spring rolls.. OMG, so tiny! Smaller than Philippine longanisa with only one small piece meat and one small shrimp.  My party and I ask for some lemon/lime, server walked away with "WE HAVE NO LIME! NO LIME TODAY!"   WHAT KIND OF PHO RESTAURANT WITH NO LEMON/LIME!?  In case anyone wondering, There is a large "Asian 168 grocery store" near by the restaurant in the same shopping center.  Over all, food is not impressed. Seafood noodle has only one piece of shrimp and one piece of squid, some beef-like meat!  Vermicelli cold noodle with no taste chicken/pork and tiny egg rolls even longanisa is bigger than that.   I highly not recommend this pho restaurant whom ran out of lime!  DO NOT COME HERE IF YOU NEED LEMON/LIME FOR YOUR PHO!

Wow! Stumbled upon this place, we were looking for some pho saw there sign and just went in and I am so glad we did! Besides are local pho place in California this is the best pho we have ever had! I judge good pho by the broth I feel the less hoisin sauce and Sriracha I have to put in that's some good pho!  They aren't stingy with the meat either another great sign!   There egg rolls were amazing great flavor. I'm knocking off a star because they're milk tea and green tea were not great.. No flavor but wouldn't deter us from coming back! If your hungover after clubbing and need your pho cure this is your place!

I started going here at the original location on Jones and Spring Mountain. I finally got a chance to go to where they moved to on Rainbow and Sahara and I literally forgot how good it was.   I think they have the best Vietnamese egg rolls ($7.99) - they're wrapped in rice paper and fried (which is my favorite way) and their chicken wings ($8.99) have a fish sauce type sauce on them which is so flipping good.   We got a rice plate ($10), oxtail pho (I think it was a little over $10), and bun bo hue ($10), and we gladly finished all of it. A big plus is their veggies for the pho are always super fresh, just like the ingredients they use for their food.   I loved the old location but this new location is cool - a little hidden - but the food is still really flipping good. The ladies are always so sweet and it's one of the best places to get pho in Vegas. Even my Vietnamese boyfriend (picky AF over Vietnamese food) loves it there.   Can't wait to come back.

Went to this place a while ago. This place was a bit far away from Chinatown so I didn't think it was going to be that good.   Yeah actually location is not that big it's very small quaint and very clean. The lady that helped us was very friendly she made a lot of suggestions.  I'm not a huge pho fan, but it was cold and I was craving some soup being a vegetarian it's hard to find places that have vegetarian pho, so this is one of the places that I found. I like their pho, the veggies were fresh and the broth was delicious. It's a bit pricey but nothing too crazy.   The thing that made the most impact was their mango boba, it tasted delicious it was freshly made and I definitely recommend this place.

I have to agree with a previous post that the price here is high. Pho is okay. The price level does not match the service or food at this place and therefore my 3 star rating is reflective of this. The high pricing point is a turn off for me to return or recommend this place especially with the service level being mediocre.
had Hi tieu nam vang( Cambodian style seaford), very good, Bang canh tom cua(udon noodle soup/ real crab meat shrimp + pork. Nuoc mat hor e(passion basil seed jellydrink), must try.

My family recently stayed in Las Vegas for 3 days and wanted to have some Vietnamese foods on our first day. We found Sing Sing on Yelp with good rating, and we glad we did come and try.  The Pho is excellent here. I am a big fan of Pho. And being a Vietnamese, I am very critical about this dish. Pho at Sing Sing was beyond my expectation. My sons are 9 and 4, and they also love it. Both of them and I ended up eating only eating Ph twice during the 3 days we were there. I am sure if we'd stay longer, we will be back again. My wife and my Mom tried "Hu tiu" (other noodle soup) and "Com tam" (Broken Rice dish), and said they are delicious also.  The restaurant is small, but very clean. The service is very quick and friendly. The owner (I think) is really nice and friendly which make our meals more comfortable and enjoyable.  I am sure every time we go to Las Vegas, this is the place we will be coming for Vietnamese foods.

Tried this place for the first time today and boy was it amazing! The vegetables were fresh and washed properly, and the place was spotless. We ordered pho tai and the broth was delicious as was the entire entree. The chicken wings here are to die for, freshly cooked and the meat was fuckin great!

Pho Sing Sing is a family owned and run restaurant. You can tell they take pride in serving high quality authentic Vietnamese food here.  Be aware that the Pho does have msg, like almost all Pho places. There was a yelp tip that said no msg here, I asked our waiter about it. He said he didn't know, so I asked one of the cooks who said they do use msg, but not a lot.  I tried the spring rolls and several vermicelli bowls. Everything was delicious. The vermicelli noodles were perfectly cooked, the bean sprouts and other veg was fresh and crispy, the meat was nicely trimmed and marinated, and the fish sauce was perfectly balanced.  So far this has been the best Vietnamese I have had in Chinatown, it sets a much higher standard for how good this food can be. I will definitely be coming back to try the other dishes.
The Pho Tai here is awesome! The restaurant is very clean and the staff very friendly and attentive. They take cash only so come prepared. Also had the egg rolls which were very tasty!

This was our first time eating Vietnamese food and we really enjoyed it!!! We had egg rolls and chicken wings for appetizer both were good. Main course was beef with rice and chicken with rice both very good!!! Meat was very tender and flavor was great. But most of all this is a family place and you can feel the love when you enter the door. Service isn't even the word we felt like we were a guest in their home. My family thanks you for a lovely dinner.

Best in Vegas and absolutely worth the drive away from the strip and Chinatown. The food is better than other popular Vietnamese restaurants in Chinatown, and renown Caesar's and Palazzo. The pho broth was boiled for 16 hours, authentic and rich. The meats were perfectly cut and did not overpower the noodles. I loved that their pho came with fresh chopped Thai chilis too (unique to their restaurant). The eggrolls were superb with chicken, pork, shrimp, all in one, and comes with a variety of vegetable lettuces that added a sense of freshness to the rolls. This place is a must try!  As for service, the restaurant is ran by five sisters who were short handed. I almost got up and left but glad I didn't. A little patience goes a long way here and they were so sweet and accommodating.

I rank this restaurant Top 5 Vietnamese restaurant in Las Vegas.  Authentic style Vietnamese.  Nice atmosphere.  Reasonable price for Las Vegas.  Good for sit down or take out.  The owner Cindy is very very nice.  She treats you like family.  Overall - As good as it gets.
I drove here and I refuse to dine at places that are cash only. Accepting credit card is a convenience for the customer. This place doesn't respect customers.

Pho is fresh, soup base is hot and tasty, service on par for the older guy and woman, the younger one needs more training in customer service, place is roomy and bright, portion to price ratio is fair, will recommend...

Good pho! I stumbled across this looking for Sylantro (which has moved or closed). It looks like they'r in the process of redoing the sinage outside, but the dining room was newly refurnished and the food was good.
Great Vietnamese Restaurant. My family and I enjoyed the food here upon our visit to Vegas. Will stop by here again next time.

One of the few times where I trusted yelp and it has disappointed me. My coworkers wanted to eat pho before heading to the IBS show and I found this spot on yelp with good reviews and was open at 9am so we gave it a try.   We were in a rush so I called ahead and ordered our food early so it'll be ready when we were there but the guy on the phone didn't speak Vietnamese... He said the owner wasn't in yet. He only knew a few words in viet. He sounded like a douche over the phone and was a little rude. That should have been the first red flag.  When we arrived, it didn't seem like a Vietnamese owned restaurant. More like a Chinese restaurant... Another red flag.  The guy that served us as friendly but he was middle eastern? He did pronounce the food names correctly in viet though... I give him that..  As for the food, my husband ordered the pho tai Bo vien with tai on the side. The beef came out first before all the food? Weird... And it was more pinkish grayish instead of bright red... Another red flag...  My coworkers order Hu tieu nam vang kho and it was okay. Some of the meats that came with it didn't belong in there... The garlic in the side looked light green?? Strange?   I ordered the Bun Bo Xao and it was okay. Not bad. Beef had some flavors but the meat was a little dry.   One thing that was better was the egg rolls. It was cooked fresh and crunchy.  Overall, I've had better. I wouldn't come back.

I've been to Vegas several times and had never tried this place out until today! My only regret was I wish I knew about this place in then past! Hands down the best place to get your pho fix! Had the bun bo hue and it's as authentic as it can get! Really good! I would totally recommend anyone that is around come to this place! Love the environment, really friendly staff and delicious food!

Just had a vegan pho with their homemade hot sauce and I will forever go to this spot. Not only is there food always delicious, fresh and homemade .. but their staff is so nice and friendly ! I recommend this place to anyone !!

So after looking for a place for good pho I finally found it! I got excited and decided to order quite a few items off the menu, plus I had my family with me and we were hungry. First let me start with the reason why we came here, the Pho. I ordered Pho Ga & my hubby ordered the combination Pho. The bowl was huge and the portions of meat and toppings did not disappoint. I have to say hands down the pho broth here is AMAZING!! It's so hard to find a good broth but look no further, because they have it here!  We also ordered fried rice, chicken fried rice to be exact-- amazing as well! The taste of this rice reminded me of a place we frequented back home and that place was known for their fried rice. The portion was very good as well.  Next we ordered two types of rolls, fried spring roll and fresh spring roll. I am not sure if that's the correct name for the fried one but that's how I've always known it as my whole life. Both were delish and both were devoured. I have to say, the peanut sauce for the fresh spring rolls was on point!  So I know at this point I probably had enough food but I'm a huge fan of chicken lemon grass so when I saw it on the menu I had to order it as well. The flavor of this lemon grass was the best I've had in Vegas, a prefect mix of spicy and a good amount of the lemon grass flavor.  Before we left we ordered some smoothies with boba to go. I had the almond coconut, my kids had the banana and peanut butter-- I tried all of them and they were all delish as well. I could clearly taste the flavor of each and it wasn't watered down like some other places. Th boba was also fresh and soft.  So that ended my feast and I can say I have found my Vietnamese food spot and I will definitely be back and recommend Pho Sing Sing to all my friends!  Oh and I can't forget the service! Exceptional!! Very attentive, very nice and very welcoming!
Good pho, and the bbh was pretty good too, if only a bit milder than most other places. Service is fast and courteous.

Needed a place to get some pho at 9am on a Tuesday in the morning and this came up during my search.  I would give this place 3 stars for the food and service here.  If I saw anything that would make me lower my rating, I will do so in the future.   I don't know how it is in the afternoon or at night for the food & service, but for the morning...It was on point.    Got a bowl of hot pho here.  The usual rare beef and beef balls.  My lady got the bowl of the usual also.  I would come back here again when in Vegas.
Extremely good food and wonderful friendly staffs. Our group had the Bun Mam and Mi Vit Tiem and they are super delicious. Highly recommended and will definitely visit again!

Always looking for a new pho place to try I knew this was next on my list. The place was pretty busy on a Saturday night at 8:30 pm so that was a good first sign. We received menus immediately and ice water. Pho tai is my go to but I decided on pho with flank and brisket this time along with the usual rare steak. The boyfriend had bun bo hue his favorite. We also ordered egg rolls to start. Very crispy and piping hot. Could have had a bit more meat but it comes with quite a few pieces so no complaints. Bowls of pho came out not too long after that. My bowl of pho was piping hot which I appreciate you could see bits of pepper floating and it was served with lemon. Waitress said limes were too expensive at the time so that was a bit of a bummer but the bowl was so good it didn't need much. Usually I only add a squeeze of lime and jalapeño to my bowl because I love the broth.  I don't like to add hoisin or sriracha to my bowl and it shouldn't need it if the broth is good. This is probably one of the best bowls I've had in a looooooooong time. I can't say enough about how much I loved my bowl of pho. Dip the meat in hoisin and sriracha and I was in heaven. My boyfriend also loved his bun bo hue. I would come here again and again it was PHOnomenal.
First time here and boy, its was good. The Nam Vang Dry Noodles was bomb!!!  Customer service was really good. They were really attentive to each table.

When I think of the ambience and food of Pho Sing Sing, I am reminded of the pretty great and authentic Vietnamese restaurants in Westminster, CA.  As you walk in, you are greeted with friendly staff, then immediately seated.  Throughout your dining experience, you will probably be asked once or twice about how everything is going - which is a bit uncommon for a Vietnamese restaurant or, perhaps even just small-business Asian restaurants in general?.  Anyway, the staff is very charming, and makes you feel welcomed.  I ordered a rice dish, which consisted of grilled pork chop, shredded pork skin, an egg cake, pickled daikon and carrots, thin slices of cucumbers, and nuoc cham (dipping sauce).  As complicated as this dish sounds, it's actually fairly simple, yet the chef(s) manage to make everything taste great, especially the smokiness of the pork chop.  Now, a lot of Vietnamese restaurants have their own recipe for nuoc cham, but Pho Sing Sing's is one of my favorites - just a smashing blend of saltiness, sweetness, and sourness.  This dish also needed more pickled daikon and carrots; I remember it having only about a handful of shreds.   Their bot chien (fried rice flour cake) was good, too. I am not a huge fan of this dish, cause I think that a lot of places make it taste bland.  However, I was surprised that I actually quite enjoyed this dish.  The rice flower cake itself was semi-crunchy, which I think is supposed to be like that - I mean, it's cooked and mixed with a scrambled egg.  Their dipping sauce for the bot chien was a good compliment to the dish as a whole.   I've also tried their dessert drinks as well.  Their basil seed drink is perfection in a cup - it's semi sweet and just tastes like liquefied jello (not in a gelatinous state) mixed with basil seeds. TRY IT!  Their mocha jelly drink was good as well - like if you were in the mood for a drink that kind of tastes like an iced chocolate milk drink and a cappuccino with jelly floating around, then I would say order this drink.  Their che 3 mau was deliciously amazing, too (it's pretty much like halo-halo). This review is getting quite long, and I'm not too sure what's in this dessert "drink," and I won't even tell you to order it.  But, if you don't, then you are missing out.    Anyway, this is a great new Vietnamese restaurant.  Give it a shot if you are ever in the mood for a new Vietnamese restaurant. I know I will be back just to try out how their other dishes taste.   Also, a tip:  they have a cash only sign, but they do accept cards through Square, I believe.  You will just be charged $1 extra.

Pretty good beef pho.  I like the stocky soup, real flavorful and u can see the beef bits.  The pho noodles were chewy not overly cooked.  My only tiny beef with the beef noodle soup is that i only got 3 slices of beef and 6 whole beef balls.  Skimped on the more expensive stuff.  And kind of stingy on the fresh veggies too.

I give 4 stars because the food here is very good and authentic! This place looses a star because the service can do with a little bit of help. It is not on the menu and there are only certain days that they have the bot chien voi truong, which is fried rice flour cakes with eggs. It is so delicious. Honestly it is the best one in town. I am always disappointed when they don't have it.  The bun rieu is amazing! It's the best restaurant bun rieu I have ever had in my life. The best one is home nade, of course. But wow. The bun rieu really blew my mind. Bun rieu is my favorite food in the entire world. It is a tomato based soup with little puffs that are similar to small dumplings made of crab and shrimp, and it usually comes with some pork, tomato wedges, and shrimp. I love how generous that they are with their portions of the dumplings and noodles. I love the broth. It is so good. I definitely reccommend this dish! I have also tried the bun thit nuong cha gio, the vermecelli noodles with grilled pork and egg rolls. DELICIOUS! The best egg rolls I have ever had. They taste jusy like how my parents make them. I love the food here! The only downside is that the servers will take your order and bring your food then leave you alone. They won't double check to see if water refills are needed. And when I need something I always have to walk up to the counter to ask in order to get their attention. But the food is great!!!

In search for the best Pho Tai in town!  After a strong recommendation from a friend, I decided to give Sing Sing a shot :)  Pho Tai ($7.95): Rare Steak Noodle Soup. SOLID bowl! Good mix of fresh, crisp, and oily broth. The noodles are a bit thinner and taste softer/fresher than most others. The steak itself cooks super fast in the broth but remains tender/flavorful.  The broth itself is a little more subtle than my favorites in town, but it is a very good bowl and worth a try!  Also tried the Thit Nuong ($3 on menu but actually $5). Very good grilled pork, cooked perfectly with crispy edges and 100% edible, non-chewy fat. Only thing I can complain about is the price...they say $3 on the menu but charged me $5. Not a huge deal to me, but this could be a problem for others. Also, at $5, this would be the MOST expensive side of grilled pork I've ordered in a Vietnamese restaurant.  Also, I was given incorrect change (even at the higher price).  Obviously it could be an honest mistake, but I am put on edge after the last minute adjustment to the price of the food as well.    Just keep it in mind when you drop your check.

This is one of the best Vietnamese restaurants I've been to! The spring rolls were perfect! The shrimp tastes fresh not fishy. I ordered the rare steak pho... There's this delicious hint of cinnamon. Everything is super fresh and the restaurant is clean. The staff is so nice. The chef lady even came out right away and asked us how our food was!

now that I've eaten here. it caught us off guard that the food would be good but it actually was. they also have good boba here nice soft texture. my wife also agreed so let's get to the meal.  egg rolls 4/5-perfect sized egg rolls that have a unique crunch to it and what I love about their egg rolls they give you a lot of vegetables I love the pickled daikon and carrot which they provide here with the lettuce and mint of course. gotta love the sweet fish dipping sauce too!  pho dac biet 4.5/5- that's a big deal because this is now my second favorite pho place to eat. the broth is awesome it's light, yet so flavorful and their pho soup was hot which is how it's supposed to be. sometimes restaurants get scared to serve it too hot as in temperature but it's supposed to be. they come with rare steak, brisket, tendon and meatballs. very good  bun lemongrass beef and onion 4/5- vermicell noodle with lemongrass beef and onion pretty decent dish if you have had bun it has similar qualities of all bun cold noodle with meat and the sweet fish sauce.  milk tea with boba 5/5 and coffee smoothie no boba- great smoothies and drink the milk tea was so good and boba was so soft I would definitely come back just for the boba.   overall it was unexpected but great meal you are now my #2 go to pho place..I'll be back for sure:

Yum!! We wanted to find a pho place to eat to cure the boyfriends hangover after NYE and went here. I've been here before once but it was 2 years ago. This was our first meal of 2018! :)   The owner is super nice and the place has plenty of parking. Lots of tables and booths, surprisingly it wasn't too crowded probably because we came a bit earlier and people were sleeping off their hangover from the night before.   I got the Bun Bo Hue and the bf got #12 pho. The Bun Bo Hue was delicious - the perfect blend of spices. The broth was sooo good and they don't hold back on the meat either.   The pho was good! My boyfriend liked it but as I didn't try it I can't say much.   I also got the matcha tea slush is which was pretty good. I normally like my drinks overwhelmingly sweet but this one wasn't too sweet - but still good!   I'll be back for sure!

My friends and I ordered pretty much everything on the menu.  Our group was huge so we got to try each other's food.  We ordered our items to go so it took a little long.  When we got our order and left, we later realized some items were missing.  The staff had called us about the mistake and apologized.  They threw in some free coffee for our troubles.  The staff were really nice and friendly.  I got the Bun Cha Gio Thit Nuong - Charbroiled Pork and Egg Rolls - I never could go wrong with this dish.  One of my faves.  I tried all of my friends' food as well.  They were good, others decent.
Good food, friendly folks.... fast service..... everything I am looking for in a lunch restaurant.  I will have to try again for dinner!

Really nice and clean place. The pho is even better than Pho so 1 and I think I can comfortably say that this restaurant may have the best pho in Las Vegas.   The special lemonade was too acidic for my taste but the mocha with coffee jelly is delicious!

So we were suppose to try the lobster pho across street, but got into the wrong restaurant, and it ends with good experience.  We had the fried chicken wings and pho combo. The wings are skinny but the Thai spicy flavor is tasty.  Their beef noodle soup is very sweet and full of beef bone flavor. They sprinkle black peppers in the soup, so if you don't like black peppers, ask them.   I think this is a good and authentic place to eat pho. Highly recommend.  P.S: they charge $1 for hot tea, so if u don't think it's reasonable, get a water instead. I've seen reviews complaining about that. To me, it's quit reasonable. Every restaurant has their own rules N charges, we either take it or leave it right!?

It's bulking season for me so, I took an empty table for 4 which got me a funny look from the server. I'm hungry and I want pho...and all the food. Don't judge me.  It's a small Vietnamese restaurant in the same complex as 168 Market. It's clean and doesn't smell funny. But you get the same cold treatment that you would expect from any Asian restaurant.  Cha Gio: Egg rolls with shrimp, chicken and pork. Hot, crispy and meat-filled fried rolls you wrap in lettuce and dip in that vinegar + fish sauce goodness. 4/5  Pho Tai Nam Gau: Beef vermicelli noodle soup with rare steak, flank and brisket. The meats were a bit too fatty compared to most places and I'm not a fan of animal fat. However, the broth was good. Next time, I'll get something with with just the rare steak (pho tai). 3.5/5  Bun Cha Gio Ga Nuong: Vermicelli bowl with egg rolls and charbroiled pork. I love this and pho. It's really tough to pick one over the other so, I had both. I was supposed to save this for dinner but I'm not a procrastinator so, I ate it like there's no tomorrow. 4/5  For all the food I got, I only paid about $27.

I went there today, and ordered a watermelon smoothie, after I got my food I didn't hear the blender, so I reminded the waiter. I guess they forgot. When I went to pay, I just paid. But later on realized they charged me for 2, oh well I guess I won't go back there again.

Decided to try this place out for dinner one night with some friends. One of my friends said their duck noodle soup was really good and I've been trying to find a pho place that I can stick to and honestly love.  So I decided to order pho of course! With beef balls and rare steak, which is typically what like to order at a restaurant. Two of my friends ordered pho while one ordered the duck noodle soup and the last ordered their beef satay noodles.   The broth was okay. It seemed normal to me. I think the flavor could be a little stronger? The broth was really light to me. At least the broth wasn't sweet! Sweet broth makes me want to pour a jar of sriracha in it to cover the sweetness. haha. The noodles seemed kind of overcooked. I actually like my beef balls to have tendons in them and theirs didn't so I was a little disappointed in that. The rare steak wasn't all that impressive to me either.   Service was okay however they did forget one of our orders. Friend ordered an avocado smoothie but it never came so she just decided to cancel it.  Overall, it was okay. I do want to go back to try some other stuff.. probably not their pho though.

Pho is one of those foods that to me it's almost impossible to mess up.   Like chicken fingers or a grilled hot dog, as long as the basic components are there, even if they're not cooked 100% to my liking I'll probably still be able to finish it off and be content.  So I often see reviewers, including my favorite reviewer of all time Tetsuro P go on about the nuances of a particular pho broth, and how different one might be to another, but to be honest my delicate palate just must not be able to distinguish those nuances.   I've had bowls from a place like Sing Sing where it's a labor of time and love to make the broth, and bowls that were whipped up in 10 minutes flat using pho cubes from 99 Ranch and enjoyed them equally.   Essentially I'm starting this review by telling you my tastebuds might be pho-tarded.    As such, my driving force on whether or not I really enjoy a pho joint is cleanliness.   Pho So 1 I had always heard was one of the best bowls in Vegas, and I did enjoy it a hell of a lot, but the 5th hand smoke lingering in the air since presumably the days of Mad Men and the fact that I feel the need to sanitize my hands every 5 minutes I'm in there bring it down a notch.   If I'm in Vietnam or when I've visited Hong Kong and Taiwan, I'm very much willing to put these things aside for the pleasures of great food, but when I can get a bowl of Pho down the street at a cleaner place and with my lack of Pho-sensibilities, I go clean over dirty any time.  Enter Pho Sing Sing:   very clean, doesnt reek of smoke, and serves a bowl of broth with noodles, beef, and other things I've never really known what they were, plus they provide sauces and the typical bean sprout/jalapeno fixings I require.   That's all I need really for a pleasant Phoxperience.   Everything tasted great, but unfortunately as I said before I couldn't really distinguish it over many other Pho bowls I've had.  Pho is just delicious, period.    They do the "stack of spoons" and "shared chopstick" method of utensil delivery which I'm not a fan of (though everything seemed clean), and service was very friendly but a little shaky.   I ordered the combination as I'd said and my friend ordered the Pho Tai, and when the server brought mine out he put it in front of my friend.   I told him I ordered the combo, and he looked at the bowl he brought out and said "yours is coming next".    3 minutes later the Pho Tai came out and we had to switch them.   To be fair the tendon and other discerning characteristics of the combo pho were somewhat hidden, but I still found that a bit sloppy.  Tighten that up and they'll be well on their way to 5 stars!

Sorry had to change my review because I came back to eat dinner here again because I missed the iced mocha jelly, my husband had pho and I had the vermicelli and a soda but when we got charged the man charged us $10 over and we didn't realize until we left as we recalculated our order.. So as a tip make sure they don't over charge you by calculating your order before you pay.. I was very disappointed...:/

So I was looking for a closer spot for some pho. Just hate driving all the way to spring mountain. So I looked up pho restaurants and came across this one. As soon as I walked in I was greeted and seated. Customer service was awesome!! Ordered pho combination and spring rolls. Oh man they were both on Hit. The pho had a great taste! Won't be driving to spring mountain for pho!
I love the bun mam here, it's so delicious...everyone here are very friendly and funny... Love this place totally come back soon.

I'll keep this short and simple, I visited this restaurant twice.   First time, I thought the food was just ok, so therefore satisfactory.   On my second visit, I ordered food to go.  One of the dishes was a $13 catfish dish, the other was a $13 shrimp dish.  When I got home, I noticed both of the relatively small containers were less then half filled. I thought could this have been a mistake? But I doubt it because it happened to both dishes.   Anyhow, I found 3 small slices of catfish wrapped in foil, barely enough to fill 1/3 of the container... My guess is I got about maybe 4 oz of catfish for $13.  NOT COOL!!!  Same goes for the shrimp dish.   Anyhow, I posted pictures for proof.  Avoid the take out.

I walked into this place and was treated horribly. I wasn't greeted, the larger parties took priority and despite there being plenty of tables to seat me, the waitress brought me a rickety foldout table. It was disgusting, well-used and pulled from the kitchen.

While I was looking at Yelp, I saw that Pho Sing Sing had 4 1/2 stars and it was located next to my favorite Chinese restaurant, Hong Kong Garden, so I decided to try it. My friend and I decided to order egg rolls and pho. The egg rolls weren't the best that I've tried in Vegas and were kind of bland even with the sauce. The pho wasn't anything special and my friend found what looked like a nose hair in her pho, but the owners said it was just hair from the beef but changed her bowl of pho. I was disgusted because I was pretty sure that was human hair. When we got the check, they did not charge us on the pho, but while we were handling the check, we saw a cockroach on the wall. Disgusting! I'm never coming back.
One of the very best vietnamese restaurants in Las Vegas !
Good flavor Pho, and love the egg rolls

Delicious!! I eat pho at least 1 time a week. Came across this little gem and thought I'd give it a try. Had the chicken lemongrass with rice. Best I've ever had! I will be back!  Thanks for the great service and food!

Definitely one of my favorite pho restaurants in Vegas! It's a little mom and Pop spot that has all the traditional dishes and tastes very authentic. Their bun bo hue and banh canh are my faves ! The drinks and desserts are really good too , they are not overwhelmingly sweet. The owner is super sweet . She reminds me of my mom .. very nurturing and easy to talk to. We came here after my gf had her wisdom teeth pulled and she went out of her way to cut the noodles for us so it would be easy to eat.
Food had no flavor, pho barely had meat it in, poor service. Barely touched my food and went straight to Pho So 1.
Man delicious pho.   Good amount of beef slices as well.  The soup came hot so that's a plus.   Ordered number 12 came fast and the sprouts basil look fresh.
Great dinner with 10 members of our family.  Pho was terrific, great spring rolls, service amazing--very personable.  Will definitely return next time in Vegas.

Excellent pho! We are visiting Vegas from Alaska and although we are staying on the strip we had to venture off to have some phò. This place didn't disappoint. We hunt out phò at any city we visit and surprisingly this was one of the best we've had so far. I ordered #15, the brisket and meatball phò. The broth was flavorfull and clean, and you could taste the aeromatics but they weren't overpowering. The meatballs were plentiful and the brisket was tender and tasty. It also wasn't overly salty and I didn't get that salt bloat I sometimes get with other phò's I've tried. The service was great, nothing to complain about there, either. We will for sure be visiting again the next time we are visiting Vegas!

This place probably taste better after you have been to The Source nearby but I thought the food was just average.  The Pho did not overwhelm me with its broth.  The service lacked in speed and friendliness.  However, I may like it better the more I go there.

FRIDAY before Palm Sunday and NO MEAT today, so we stopped by nearby and ordered Mi Sau Shrimp and Yellow noodles with fish soup.  The menu lists many of my favorites, so I'll just have to come back, I said to myself and try some of these when we are around Sahara. (I wonder if the Lemon Grass Chicken will be to my liking), anticipating a new found restaurant!  I must say the soup was so flavorful and the Vietnamese Chop Suey was delicious. 1 star for courteous, 1 star  for clean, 1 star for flavor!  PROBLEMS: My veggie with shrimp was soaked with gravy and did not come with rice or any carb.   The seafood noodle was 70% soup.  They asked if we preferred water or tea without telling us it was NOT FREE.    I AM UPDATING MY REVIEW: Got home and I had to go to the bathroom right away. THIS MORNING,  we both suffered from diarrhea. MUST BE SOMETHING IN THE FOOD.OR IN THE PREPARATION !!!!!!! Sorry, won' be coming back.

So excited that they just moved into my neighborhood. We came in for a late lunch and loved it. The broth for the pho was outstanding! High quality beef that tasted very fresh. We started with the egg rolls and would highly recommend them as well. Everyone that helped us was very attentive and made us feel so welcome. I have been hoping to have a restaurant that I love move into this area and have finally found it. They deliver within 3 miles too, so I can be as lazy as I want to be and enjoy their yummy food.

I ventured off the beaten path from my regular pho spots and decided to dine at Pho Sing Sing. I recalled a best pho thread on Yelp Talk and several people said the pho here is pretty darn good. My friend and I ordered eggrolls, spring rolls and pho tai. Eggrolls had a different kind of wrapper and was really really good. The spring rolls were wrapped fresh and had a nice chewy consistency. Even the shrimp inside tasted fresh. The pho was beyond my expectations. It had a nice light, clean broth and the tai meat was tender. Plenty of meat and perfectly textured noodles  I'm sold on the pho alone but the customer service will always keep me coming back. The ladies/owners that run the place were so kind! All 3 ladies that helped us exuded joy, kindness and genuinely wanted us to enjoy our experience. I felt like they were my Vietnamese aunties goading us to enjoy our food. I love this place!

Originally my friend and I were going to Pho Lan to give it a try since its her name, but it was closed on Sunday. So a quick Yelp check offered up this place which I'd never been to. When I did get there, I realized I had been there before...a couple times, but when it was under different ownership. Not sure when this changed hands.  My friend ordered the Pho, I went with the shrimp and pork spring rolls and lemongrass chicken over rice. I sampled the Pho and it was pretty tasty and looked like a decent portion. The lemongrass chicken was very flavorful, although a touch dry but you could tell they had grilled it on order. Spring rolls were weird because one was huge, and the other small. Decent flavor a little light on the pork but good. Thai tea with boba was a bit too sweet for my taste, and too much ice in the cup.  Overall, it was decent, and like its predecessor, I would come back. Still have a few more places to try though.  One note - Cash only and there's an ATM at the CVS Pharmacy nearby.

I recommend skipping this place in the future.  5.24.2015 down to 2 stars I brought family this time to show off how good this place was. However, was met with disappointment. Super disappointed that the quality has gone down. Egg Rolls are still good. Meat cuts are still good. Pho noodles came out too soft. Soup base came out bland like it had not been prepped properly... so I reached for the fish sauce. Had to add fish sauce--but their cut out on the bottle was so big that i nearly dumped half of the bottle into my bowl. I tried to fix it by quickly scooping out the excess sauce--which turned out ok. I tried to ask for a replacement but all the workers were way too busy in the backroom to respond to me. So i just ate the meat cuts. We also ordered a grilled meat dish. The moment it cooled down, the meat became crispy and sweet like candied meats. Not a fan. Service was mediocre. The waiter messed up on our order and forgot that two members of our party ordered food. Our food came out but half of our table's food didn't. After waiting awhile, we asked and it turned out that their orders were not it. So then their food came out toward the end of our meal. Tried the drinks too -- Stop here and save your money. Basil seed drink and the matcha tea shake. Basil seed was way too sweet like syrup out of a can. Matcha tea had way too much cream and not enough matcha--it's like drinking a cup of half and half in shake form.
I am trying Pho  rare steak, flank and brisket!! With a passionfruit smoothie and a mango smoothie!! Trying to get my vitamins in this sun!!

My girlfriend & I stopped here on a very cold and windy day and we're glad we found this place! Definitely a go to spot for pho. Everything was different from the regular pho places we've been to. We ordered fresh spring rolls & egg rolls which were amazing. They looked different, but were filled with flavor. Then we ordered rare steak and brisket pho, and rare steak, flank and brisket  pho. The broth was THE BEST I have ever tasted. I usually add all the condiments, but with this, I didn't feel the need to. I thought I would ruin it if I added anything else because that was how good it was! On top of that, the service was excellent. We were treated like family. I'll definitely be coming back.

Been here now about seven times.  Every time it is spot on.  Consistency is the key and this place is clean, peaceful and the pho is amazing.  This is my go to pho place in Vegas. I was yearning for a slice of back east andI found it.  If you are looking for the best pho in town look no further.
Great place to try Vietnamese food! #30 was an amazing dish. Don't for get to try them out!!
Great pho, very delicious and large portion. Super nice service, very polite and honest staff. Will be definitely back the next time we visit Vegas.
Good food and friendly staff.   Just remember to check with the wait person about the ingredients if you are allergic to peanuts.  We make a special trip across town just to eat there.

I am really disappoint. definitely won't come back again.  I come in with my little sister the other day, I ordered myself a special pho, told the waiter clearly that I don't want any green onions, i really hate the taste of it, but when the waiter brings the food, it don't have green onion, that's good, but it also missing cilantro and regular onion.   So, I ask him, can I have some cilantro? he pause a bit and went back to kitchen, few seconds he is back, and guess what he told me? he told me:" sorry we DON'T have cilantro"  I know HE WAS LYING but I didn't say anything because my little sis is with me that day. also when we half way done with our meal, the other customer order a pho and I SAW HIM CARRY WITH CILANTRO to serve them.  what can I say? that's not a busy day, only us and another table, he or the chef didn't wants satisfy the customer is fine, or maybe the owner didn't care either, I will definitely won't recommend this place and me and my friends won't come back again!!!

Fantastic food and service! This restaurant serves the best Vietnamese egg rolls in Las Vegas. My husband and I ordered the pho and beef satay pho and it was very tasty and full of flavor. The staff was so nice and friendly. I highly recommend this restaurant:)

Cash only!  I would have ordered more, but I spent the last of my precious cash for a hair cut plus tips earlier.  So after making sure I had enough to cover what I ordered (Shredded Pork, Charbroiled Pork& Egg Loaf with Broken Rice), I waited patiently for my food. Leos L was not as lucky, and had to make a run for 168 Market before they closed (which turned out to be a good thing, as he scored on some end of the day dim sum specials).  Anyway, service here is average.  They are nice and promptly delivers the food once it is prepared by the kitchen, just like most other restaurants.  The food was just A-OK as well.  I have had better and I have had worst.  Room for improvements?  Yes!  But the broken rice plate that I ordered was decent, and I cleaned my plate.  Portion was average. Enough for the average diner.  What I think can be improved upon (how they prepare the grilled pork on the com tam and bun dishes).  One of the things that Leos and I both agreed on during this meal is that there are a lot of Vietnamese restaurants here in Las Vegas. Pho Sing Sing, being a Vietnamese restaurant does an okay job at it.  But we both wonder is being just okay enough?  Or does a restaurant needs to offer something special that they alone does very well to keep customers coming back for more.  That is the $150,000 question.  As for me, I will come back to check out their pho menu, but for com tam (broken rice) I already have a favorite in town.  Besides the typical Vietnamese pho restaurant menu offerings, they serve boba as well.  A-OK.  (Former location of Taiwan Kitchen)

This 3 star review comes from two vastly different experiences. The food was absolutely fabulous. I'd say the food was a 4 and half star. I absolutely loved it, but the service I recieved was horrendous. I walked in and the place was pretty busy, so I'm not going to hold it against them that I had to wait for someone to approach me and seat me. that was the start, I was essentially left alone for about 10 minutes until the waitress came and took my order, at which time she brought me the water I asked for the second I entered. My food was brought out to me, and not a word was said or even a look at me. It was almost as if se didn't want to be there and I was an annoyance. While eating, it took a superhuman effort to get the waitress' attention just to get a refill on the water. It wasn't very pleasant The food, on the other hand was da B-O-M-B. I started off with the chicken wings and fish oil sauce, and needless to say it blew my socks off. The chicken was perfectly fried, and the sauce complemented it perfectly. In fact the only bad thing was that i burned my tongue because I'm too impatient to let it cool down. For my main appetizer, I decided not to get pho, but actually to try their broken rice because thats one of my favorite things. The pork was delicious and tender. I almost licked the plate clean is how good I loved it. but in the end, as much as I loved the food, the service left a bad taste in my mouth. As someone who knows how restaurants work behind the  scenes, I tend to give a little more leeway for bad service because I know waiters get busy and they are generally doing what they can. This though, was a little too much. No check to make sure everything is fine with the food, not once did she ask me if i needed more water. I understand that she had other tables and large parties, but I am still a paying customer and I still would like to feel welcomed when I go out to eat. I'm very undecided on whether or not I'll return here

Came here for a Sunday brunch after a long night in Vegas. Read some reviews on Yelp and thought this place would provide us with some hangover cures. Totally did not disappoint!  I had their banh canh with crab meat while my buddy had their vermicelli with shredded pork. Both dishes were amazing!  The staff members were even more amazing!  They were friendly and attentive. We even considered to come back again on Monday before heading back to la.

I loved this place pho was awesome taro smoothie was good as well but the service was slow no body going around filling waters . Sucks because I really wanted to love this place . Everybody was nice tho I just hate when places let that slack everybody was talking and looking at computers and tablets kinda sucks when their was only 3 tables when I was their

This is the Pho restaurant that most of the Japanese people in town recommend, so I decided to try it out a few months ago and now my coworkers and I meet here regularly.   I've noticed at 2am some nights when I'm driving by Pho Sing Sing, that the lights in the kitchen are still on and someone is preparing the broth for the pho. The manager of this restaurant informed me that there is always someone around to make sure the broth is perfectly supervised. Special attention is put into the broth at Sing Sing, the type of attention that the other Pho restaurants neglect due to various reasons I will explain later. The heat that the broth is boiled in must be at a specific temperature or the taste will deviate. Sing Sing prides themselves on consistency, and makes sure that during the cooking process, the heat never exceeds or falls below the standard which produces the most quality broth. For a more bold taste, the bones still have the meat on them when boiled along with various spices such as Saigon cinnamon, ginger, and a particular secret spice recipe that Sing Sing has developed. This method of intense cooking removes any reason to put MSG into the broth. The reason why all the other pho places(most particularly Pho So 1 and Kim Long) pack their broth with MSG is because they absolutely have to in order to serve the gigantic crowds that rush in 24 hours a day. Yes, because the 24 hour Pho restaurants never close, they need to rush the cooking process or they will run out of broth. This is the reason the Pho usually tastes very weak, and to mask some of that weak taste they use MSG. Pho Sing Sing absolutely does not use MSG. But, who cares about that...Japan has used more MSG(Ajinomoto) than any other country in the world and they also happen to have one of the lowest cancer rates in the world, and they live longer than Westerners. There actually has never been any study that proves that MSG is detrimental to an individual's health. But regardless, Sing Sing does not use it at all due to the reasons I mentioned.   They serve oxtail here but you gotta come early because they sell out. The oxtail is boiled for over 20 hours, so the meat literally falls of the bone. They also give you a ton of steamed onions with it. There is nothing else like oxtail with srirachi, hoisin, and onions with your pho.   The reason why Pho comes out in less than 5 minutes at other restaurants like Pho Kim Long is because it's cooked ahead of time. That's also why all the noodles stick together. The reason why it takes a longer time here is because they cook the noodles when you order it, just like at Ramen-Yas. What I like the best about the noodles at Sing Sing is the medium-firmness from being cooked at the moment before serving.   Pho Sing Sing is the only Pho restaurant I have ever been to that actually has good service, or even service at all. I love Pho Little Saigon but after the server brings you your Pho, you never see another living person again. Same sh!t goes on at Kim Long and especially at Pho So 1.   By reading yelp reviews, it's hard to determine which Pho restaurant to go to. Like I mentioned in my "Pho Saigon" review, there is a "PHO WAR" going on between Vietnamese restaurant owners who sabotage each other's businesses with fake reviews. Also, other races of Asians tend to be ignorant of each other's cuisine. For example, Many Chinese and Koreans will complain that Miso Ramen is too salty, and Shoyu ramen is not salty enough. They don't realize that in Japan, Miso is meant to be extra salty, and Shoyu is meant to have a subtle flavor.   What I am trying to say is that every single Pho restaurant on LV yelp has a very low rating(3 stars), but that is not a reflection on how good the places really are for various reasons.
Came back for Bun Bo Hue, but the broth wasn't as flavorful like the first time I had it.

Looking to try a something new in the area when the pho craving struck. I came here with a friend who was in the mood for some bo kho.   I ordered the rare steak and brisket pho and the order came out quickly. I enjoyed my meal and the atmosphere was nice. The broth was flavorful.   The service was a little spotty but since we were chatting it wasn't to frustrating. If we were in a rush, I can see it getting on my nerves, overall I enjoyed my meal. My friend wasn't a fan of her stew and i would probably stick to their pho and vermicelli bowls in the future.
Delicious homemade pho recipes.  This place was a little hard to find, but the food was fresh and delicious.  I highly recommend it!

Delicious food and fantastic service!! The food was everything Pho should be and the servers were beyond excellent. They were fast, courteous, and even took custom food orders. When my friend added too much cream to her iced coffee, they brought her a replacement at no charge. The chicken wings were also so tangy and delicious!! We will visit again!
